content:
しな〔科〕
〈名〉
1. (=芝居のしぐさ)acting; business
2. (=女の嬌態)airs and graces; coquetry

content.content: しなをする女だ
She puts on airs and graces―She is a coquettish girl.
しなを作ってものを言う
She has a coquettish way of talking.
しなをつくってニッコリ笑った
She smiled coquettishly.
じんく踊らば
If you will dance a jig,
科よく踊れ
Go foot it with a grace!
科の好いのは
I'll take to wife and hug
嫁にする
The best that foots the pace.

content:
しな〔支那〕
〈固名〉China:(=の) Chinese

content.content: その船はいま支那へ行っている
The ship is now in Chinese waters.
支那人
a Chinese―a Chinaman―(総称すれば)―the Chinese
支那人は金儲けに抜け目が無い
The Chinese are shrewd men of business.
支那語
(the) Chinese (language)
支那学
sinology
支那学者
a sinologue
支那料理
Chinese cookery―Chinese food.
支那町
a China town―a Chinese quarter
支那鞄
a Chinese trunk
支那焼
china
あの人は支那通だ
He is well versed in Chinese affairs―an authority on Chinese affairs.

content:
しな〔品〕
〈名〉
1. (=品物)an article:(集合的に言えば)goods; wares

content.content: 品を仕入れる
to lay in a stock of goods
店には品がたくさんある
They have a large stock on hand―The shop is well stocked.
店に品が無くなった
The shop is out of stock―bare of stock.
品数
an assortment of goods
品数を揃える(揃えて置く)
to make ［keep］ a good assortment of goods
あの店は品数が揃っている
The have a good assortment of goods at that shop.

content: 2. (=品質)quality

content.content: これは品が好い
This is superior in quality―of good quality.
これは品が落ちます
This is inferior in quality―of poor quality―The quality falls short of the standard.
品が好くなった
It has improved in quality.
品が落ちた
It has deteriorated in quality.
品を落とさないようにしなけりゃならぬ
We must be careful not to lower the quality―to keep up the standard.
品が違います
It is different in quality―The differ in quality.
品によって値段が違う
The price differs according to the quality―The price varies with the quality.
処変れば品変る
Each country has its own custom.
言葉多きは品少し
He is all talk and no deed―“Empty vessels make the most noise.”
手を換え品を換え
to ring the changes on anything
手を換え品を換えて口説いた
He made love to her by resorting to every possible means.

content:
しない〔市内〕
〈名〉The city:(副詞に用いれば)within the limits of the city

content.content: 市内は無賃配達
Delivered free of charge within the city limits.
保証人は一戸を有する市内居住者に限る
The surety must be a city-resident who keeps his own house.
(郵便の)市内配達
city delivery
(新聞の)市内版
the city edition

しない〔竹刀〕
〈名〉A bamboo-sword; a foil

content:
じない〔寺内〕
〈副〉Within the precincts of a temple

content.content: 戦国時代には学問は寺内に限られた
In the age of civil wars, learning was confined within the precincts of Buddhist temples.

content:
じない〔地内〕
〈副〉In the grounds; within the precincts; on the premises

content.content: 地内に立ち入るべからず
No trespassing on the premises―“Trespassers will be prosecuted.”

content:
しなう〔嫋う〕
〈自動〉To bend; to be pliant; to be pliable; to be lithe; to be lissome; to be limber; to be supple; to be flexible

content.content: 釣竿はしなうから折れない
A fishing-rod will bend, and not break.
鯨の骨はよくしなう
Whalebone is pliant.

content:
しなうす〔品薄〕
〈名〉Scarcity of goods; shortage of stock:(形容詞に用いれば)scarce; short of stock

content.content: この品は品薄すになった
The article has become scarce―run short.

content:
しなおし〔仕直し〕
〈名〉Repetition; renewal

content.content: 仕事の仕直しをする
to repeat one's task―do one's work over again
用意の仕直しをする
to renew one's preparations―prepare once more

content:
しなおす〔仕直す〕
〈他動〉To repeat; to renew; to do (anything) over again

content.content: 仕事を仕直す
to repeat one's task―do one's work over again
用意を仕直す
to renew one's preparations―prepare once more

しながき〔品書き〕
〈名〉An inventory of goods; a list of goods; a catalogue of goods:(料理なら)a bill of fare

content:
しなかず〔品数〕
〈名〉The number of articles; an assortment of goods

content.content: 品数を揃える(揃えておく)
to make ［keep］ a good assortment of goods
あの店は品数が揃っている
They have a good assortment of goods at that shop.

content:
しなぎれ〔品切れ〕
〈形〉Out of stock:(本なら)out of print

content.content: その品は品切れです
The article is out of stock―We are out of the article.
この本は品切れです
The book is out of print.
品切れになる
to run out of stock―run out of the article―(本なら)―run out of print
本書は大好評につき品切の虞れあり
The public is enthusiastic over the book, which is in danger of running out of print.
品切(店の貼出し)
All sold―Sold out.

しなさだめ〔品定め〕
〈名〉Criticism:(=する) to criticize

しなしたり
〈間投詞〉Oh! what have I done?

content:
しなじな〔品々〕
〈名〉
1. (=色々の品)various articles

content.content: 見事なる品々有難く受納仕候
Accept my cordial thanks for your beautiful presents.

content: 2. (=種々)various kinds

content.content: 帽子は品々あります
We have various kinds of hats.

content:
しなだれる〔萎垂れる〕
〈自動〉To lean against, nestle to, snuggle to (one)

content.content: 女が男に甘えるようにしなだれかかった
The girl nestled coquettishly to the man.
酔漢が女にしなだれかかった
The drunken fellow snuggled to the girl.

content:
しなに
〈接尾詞〉When

content.content: 行きしなに君の処へ寄ろう
I will look in upon you when I am going there―on my way there.
帰りしなに買って来た
I bought it when I was coming home―on my way home.
寝しなに物を食うな
Do not eat when you go to bed―before going to bed.

content:
しなびる〔萎びる〕
〈自動〉To shrivel; to wither; to wilt

content.content: しなびたリンゴ
a shrivelled apple
しなびた足
a withered leg
花がしなびた
The flowers are withered―wilted.
しなびた老人の顔
a wizen old face―a wizened old face

しなぶれ〔品触れ〕
〈名〉A report of (lost) goods

content:
しなもの〔品物〕
〈名〉An article:(集合的に言えば)goods; wares

content.content: どんな品物をお扱いになりますか
What sort of goods do you deal in?
品物を仕入れる
to lay in a stock of goods
品物を一々手に取って見たわけではない
I did not examine the goods one by one.
品物で払う
to pay for anything in kind

content:
しなやか〔嫋か〕
〈形〉
1. (=柔軟)pliant; pliable; lithe; lissom; limber; limp; supple; flexible

content.content: 手がしなやかでないとこの仕事はできない
One must have supple hands―flexible hands―to do this work.
踊子は身体がしなやかだ
The dancing-girl has a lithe body―a lissom body.
しなやかな枝
a pliant branch―a limber branch
しなやかな表紙
a limp cover

content: 2. (=しとやか)graceful

content.content: しなやかな舞の手
the graceful movements of the dance

content:
じならし〔地均し〕
〈名〉
1. Levelling the ground

content.content: 地ならしをする
to level the ground―smooth the ground―roll the ground(with a roller)

content: 2. (=地均し機械)a roller

じなり〔地鳴り〕
〈名〉Rumbling in the earth

content.content: 地鳴りがする
The earth rumbles―Rumblings are heard in the bowels of the earth.

content:
しなれる〔仕慣れる〕
〈他動〉To be accustomed to do (anything)

content.content: 仕慣れた仕事
a familiar task

content:
しなれる〔死なれる〕
〈受動〉To have (some one) die; to lose (some one); to be bereaved of (some one)

content.content: 女房に死なれた
I have had my wife die―lost my wife―buried my wife.
女房に死なれて困りました
Her death has fallen heavily upon me.
彼は細君に死なれてひどく困っている
His wife's death has cut him up terribly.
あの女は夫に死なれた
She has had her husband die―She has lost her husband―She is mourning for her husband.
あの人は子どもに死なれた
He has had a child die―He is bereaved of a child.

しなわけ〔品分け〕
〈名〉Assortment; classification:(=する) to assort (goods); to classify (things)

content:
しなん〔指南〕
〈名〉Teaching; instruction:(=する) to teach (one anything); to instruct (one in anything); to give lessons (in anything)

content.content: 碁を指南する
to give lessons in go
柔術の指南を受ける
to take lessons in jujutsu
生花指南
Lesson given in flower-arrangement.

しなん〔至難〕
〈形〉Most difficult; arduous (task, etc.)

じなん〔次男〕
〈名〉A second son; a cadet

content:
しにおくれる〔死に後れる〕
〈他動〉To outlive, survive (one)

content.content: 妻は夫に死に後れた
She outlived―survived―her husband.
死に後れて恥をさらした
He outlived his fame.

content:
しにがお〔死に顔〕
〈名〉A dead face

content.content: 死に顔が好い、死に顔が悪い
to look well in death―look ill in death

content:
しにかける〔死にかける〕
〈自動〉To be dying; to lie at the point of death; to be at death's door; to be at one's last gasp

content.content: 行ってみると死にかけていた
I found him dying―at his last gasp.

content:
しにかた〔死に方〕
〈名〉A manner of dying; a form of death

content.content: 幸福な死に方をする
to die a happy death
震死は畢竟幸福な死に方だ
A man who is struck dead by lightning dies a happy death after all.

content:
しにがたい〔死に難い〕
〈形〉Hard-lived; tenacious of life

content.content: 猫は死に難い
The cat is a hard-lived animal.

content:
しにがね〔死に金〕
〈名〉
1. (=自分の葬式費)money for one's own funeral expenses

content.content: 死に金は用意してある
I have laid by something against my death.

content: 2. (=無効な金)money spent in vain; wasted money

content.content: 死に金を使う
to waste money―spend money in vain―pay for a dead horse

content:
しにがみ〔死に神〕
〈名〉The god of death

content.content: 死に神にとりつかれる
to be possessed with death

content:
しにぎわ〔死に際〕
〈名〉The close of one's life; one's last moments; one's declining years

content.content: 彼は死に際に信心家になった
He became religious towards the close of his life.
彼は死に際が好かった
He met his end like a brave man―died game.
死に際が悪かった、死に際が見苦しかった
He showed himself a coward in his last moments.
死に際に懺悔した
He made a clean breast of the matter on his deathbed.
死に際の懺悔
a deathbed confession
死に際を楽にする
to smoothe one's declining years―smoothe an old man's path to the grave

content:
しにくい〔仕にくい〕
〈形〉Hard, difficult (to do anything)

content.content: そう問われると返事がしにくい
To that question, I find it hard to answer.

しにぐち〔死に口〕
〈名〉The words of the dead speaking through a medium

content:
しにざま〔死に様〕
〈名〉Manner of death

content.content: 見苦しい死にざまをした
He died an ignominious death―He showed himself a coward in his last moments.

content:
しにせ〔老舗〕
〈名〉
1. (=古い店)a shop of old standing; a long-established house
2. (=店の株、暖簾)goodwill

content.content: 老舗を売る
to sell the goodwill of a firm

content:
しにそこない〔死に損ない〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: しにぞこない〔死に損ない〕

しにぞこない〔死に損ない〕
〈名〉A dotard; an old imbecile

content:
しにたえる〔死に絶える〕
〈自動〉To die out; to become extinct

content.content: 一家死に絶えた
The family has died out―The family is extinct.
アイヌ人は今に死に絶える
The Ainos are dying out.

content:
しにはじ〔死に恥〕
〈名〉Disgrace in death

content.content: 死に恥をさらす
to die an ignominious death

content:
しにばな〔死に花〕
〈名〉A glorious death; fame won in old age

content.content: 死に花を咲かせる
to die a glorious death―make a name in one's old age

content:
しにみず〔死に水〕
〈名〉Water given to a dying person

content.content: 死に水を取る
to give the last water to a dying person―smoothe one's dying pillow
俺が死に水を取って貰う者はお前一人だ
You are the only one I look to to smoothe my dying pillow.

content:
しにめ〔死に目〕
〈名〉Presence at one's death

content.content: 彼の死に目に逢った
I was present at his death―I attended his deathbed.
彼の死に目に逢わなかった
I could not attend his deathbed―I was away when he died.
碁打親の死に目に逢わず
A go-player can not attend his father's deathbed (the game is so absorbing).

content:
しにものぐるい〔死に物狂い〕
〈名〉Desperation; the fury of desperation; blind fury:(=の) desperate:(=に) desperately; with desperation; with the fury of desperation

content.content: 死に物狂いになる
to be driven to desperation
人は死に物狂いになると怖いぞ
Do not drive a man to desperation!
彼らは死に物狂いに奮闘した
They fought desperately―with desperation―with the fury of desperation―with the courage of despair.

content:
しにやまい〔死に病〕
〈名〉A fatal disease

content.content: この病は死に病だ
This disease proves fatal.

content:
しによう〔死に様〕
〈名〉A manner of dying; a form of death

content.content: 不幸な死にようをする
to die an unhappy death

content:
しにわかれる〔死に別れる〕
〈自動〉To be separated by death; to lose (a parent); to be bereaved of (a child)

content.content: 彼は幼い時に両親に死に別れた
He lost his parents―He was left an orphan―in his infancy.
彼とは死に別れた
Death separated us.

content:
しにん〔死人〕
〈名〉A dead person:(集合的に言えば)the dead

content.content: 死人があった
Lives were lost.
死人の山を築いてみせる
I will strew the ground with heaps of corpses.
死人に口無し
“ Dead men tell no tales.”
死人のような顔
a deathlike face―a cadaverous face―a ghastly face

content:
じにん〔自任〕
〈名〉Profession; pretension:(=する) to profess to be (a scholar); to pretend to (learning); to lay claim to (learning); to set up for (a scholar); to call oneself (something); to think oneself to be (something)

content.content: 僕は学者をもって自任はせぬ
I do not profess to be a scholar―pretend to learning―lay claim to learning.
彼は世間通をもって自任している
He pretends to a knowledge of the world―sets up for a man of the world.
天才をもって自任している
He calls himself a genius―fancies himself to be genius.
彼は愚直をもって自任している
He calls himself simple and honest―gives himself the character of honest simplicity.

content:
じにん〔自認〕
〈名〉Self-acknowledgement:(=する) to acknowledge oneself (beaten); to own oneself (to be inferior, etc.)

content.content: 彼は負けたことを自認している
He has acknowledged himself beaten―acknowledged his defeat.
彼は僕に敵わぬことを自認している
He owns himself to be my inferior―owns his inferiority to me.

じにん〔辞任〕
〈名〉Resignation:(=する) to resign (one's post)

content:
しぬ〔死ぬ〕
〈自動〉To die; to decease; to perish; to expire; to breathe one's last; to give up the ghost; to pass away; to suffer death; to meet one's death; to meet one's end; to end one's life; to end one's earthly career; to end one's days; to lose one's life; to depart this life; to leave this world; to go out of the world; to go the way of all flesh; to go the way of all the earth; to go the way of nature; to pay the debt of nature; to go to one's long account; to join the majority; to sink into the grave; to shuffle off this mortal coil

content.content: 彼は三年前に死んだ
He died three years ago―He has been dead these three years.
彼女の夫は三年前に死んだ
Her husband died three years ago―She buried her husband three years ago―She has been a widow these three years.
彼は死ぬと言っている
(病気でなら)He says he shall die―(決心なら)―He says he will die.
死んでしまうなどと言っている
He talks of dying.
死ぬ死ぬと言う者に死んだ例し無し
One who talked of dying, was never known to die.
あの時は死ぬかと思った
I feared I should die.
死のうと思った
I thought I would die―I resolved to die.
死のうかとまでも思った
I even thought of dying.
今にも死ぬかと思った
I felt as if my last hour had come.
今死ぬか今死ぬかと思った
I expected to die every moment.
今頃死んでおられぬ
I can not afford to die yet.
この子にかかっては死んでしまいそうだ
This child will be the death of me.
眠るように死ぬ
to pass away calmly―die a calm death
安らかに死ぬ
to depart in peace
苦しんで死ぬ
to die a painful death―die in agony
ひと思いに死ぬ
to put oneself out of misery―kill oneself
ひと思いに死なしておくれ
Put me out of misery!
ひと思いに死んだ方が楽だ
Death is a single pang and soon over.
畳の上で死ぬ
to die in one's bed
あれは畳の上で死ぬ奴ではない
He will come to the gallows.
潔く死ぬ
to die like a man―meet one's death like a man―die game
国の為に死ぬ
to die for one's country―lay down one's life for one's country
国の為なら死に甲斐がある
One's country is worth dying for.
名をの残して死ぬ
to leave a name behind one
彼は借金を残して死んだ
He left debts behind him.
金を残して死ぬ
to die rich
彼は百万円残して死んだ
He died worth a million.
貧乏して死ぬ
to die poor
年をとって死ぬ
to die old
彼は若くて死んだ
He died young―sank into an early grave.
彼は故郷に帰って死んだ
He lived to see his native land.
息子の出世を見て死んだ
He lived to see his son a great man.
死に行ったようなものだ
He went there, only to die.［注意］「殺す」(kill)を「死ぬ」の他動詞構文に用いること多し。
彼は馬から落ちて死んだ
He was killed by a fall from his horse―The fall killed him.
(地震の時外へ出るのも善し悪しだ)落ちる瓦に当たって死ぬ者がある
Some people are killed by falling tiles―Falling tiles will kill people.
あまり勉強すると死ぬぞ
If you work too hard, you will kill yourself―Overwork will kill you―You will work yourself to death.
あまり酒を飲むと死ぬぞ
Too much wine will kill you―You will drink yourself to death.
彼は酒で死んだ
Wine killed him―Wine was the death of him―Wine was the end of him―He drank himself to death.
こんなに飲んだら死んでしまう
So much wine would kill me.
人が電車に轢かれて死んだ
A man was killed by a car.
彼は戦争へ行って死んだ
He went to the war and got killed―He fell in battle.

content: 《a》(何で死ぬ)

content.content: 病気で死ぬ
to die of an illness
彼は何で死んだか
What did he die of?
コレラで死んだ
He died of cholera―succumbed to cholera―fell a prey to cholera.
何千人という人がコレラで死んだ
Thousands fell preys to cholera―Cholera carried off thousands.
この病で死ぬ者がある
Some people die of this disease―Some cases of this disease prove fatal.
この病にかかるとたいがい死ぬ
Most cases prove fatal.
老死で死ぬ
to die of old age
肺病で死ぬ者は少なくなった
Few people now die of consumption.
彼はけがをして死んだ
He died of a wound―He succumbed to a wound―His wound proved mortal.
彼は飲み過ぎて死んだ
He died from drinking too much.
河豚を食って死んだ
He died from eating the globe-fish.
雷に打たれて死ぬ
to be struck dead by lightning
河で死ぬ(水に溺れて死ぬ)
to be drowned
この河で死に損なったことがある
I once came near being drowned in this river.
彼に河で死ぬところを助けられた
He rescued me from drowning.
身投げして死ぬ
to drown oneself in a river
井戸へ入って死ぬ
to drown oneself in a well
彼は人手にかかって死んだ
He died by the hand of his enemy.
彼女は夫の後を追って死んだ
She followed her husband to the grave.
餓え死ぬ
to starve to death―die of hunger―perish with hunger
焼け死ぬ
to be burnt to death
凍って死ぬ
to freeze to death
窒息して死ぬ
to be suffocated to death―choked to death―stifled to death―smothered to death

content: 《b》(死んだ)

content.content: 彼はもう死んだ
He is dead.
死んだ人
a dead man―(集合的に言えば)―the dead―the departed.
死んだ人のことを悪く言うな
Never speak ill of the dead―“Nil nisi bonum.”
死んだ親
my deceased father
死んだ夫
my late lamented
死んだ女房
my lamented wife
死んだ人の魂
a departed soul
死んだ子の年を数える
to indulge in vain regrets―“cry over spilt milk ”
君は死んだものとばかり思っておった
I supposed you to be dead.
君は死んだものと諦めておった
I gave you up for lost.
(彼は生きているとは名ばかりで)死んだと言わぬばかりだ
He is all but dead.
死んだも同然だ
He is as good as dead―virtually dead―practically dead―to all intents and purposes, a dead man.
彼は死んだように動かなかった
He made no movement as if he were dead―(は直訳、これを英語ふうに言えば)―He might have been dead for all the movement he made.
死んだ真似をする、死んだふりをする
to pretend to be dead―feign death―play possum
俺が死んだらこの人を親と思って仕えよ
When I am gone,―When I am no more,―look upon this man as your father!
親が死んだ時死に目に逢わなかった
When my father died,―At my father's death,―I was not present at his deathbed.

content: 《c》(死んで)

content.content: この絵は死んでいる
This painting lacks life.
死んで名を残す
to leave a name behind one
君は死んで何にを残す
What are you going to leave behind you?
彼が死んで残すものは借金ばかり
He will leave nothing but debts behind him.
主人の金を無くしたから死んでお詫びをする
I have lost my master's money, and I will atone for my fault with my life.
死んで花実が咲くものか
Death ends all.
死んでしまえ
Die!―go to Hell!―go to the devil!
彼は死んでしまった
He is dead and gone.
死んでしまえば万事帳消し
“Death pays all debts.”
親が死んでから伯(叔)父のところに世話になっております
I have lived with my uncle since my father died.

content: 《d》(死んでも)

content.content: たとい死んでも目的を遂げる
I will accomplish my purpose even if I die for it―even if it cost me my life.
武士は我が子が死んでも泣かぬ
A samurai does not cry over the death of his child.
今死んでも思い残すことさらに無し
Even if I were to die tomorrow,―I should leave the world without regret.
死んでもご恩は忘れません
I shall remember your kindness the longest day I have to live.
死んでも放さぬ
to grip like grim death
死んでも命のあるように
Buddha grant that I may have life after death!

content: 《e》(死にかける)

content.content: 彼は死にかけている
He is dying―He lies at the point of death―He is at death's door.
行ってみると彼は死にかけていた
I found him dying―at his last gasp.
まだ死にきれないでいる
He is not yet quite dead.
病人は死にそうだ
The invalid is likely to die.
死にそうな病人
a dying man
仕事が苦しくて死にそうだ
The strain of work is killing me.

content: 《f》(死ぬまで)

content.content: 死ぬまで奮闘する
to fight to the death―fight to the last―fight to the last drop of one's blood
死ぬまで働く
to die in harness
死ぬまで研究を止めぬ
I shall go on studying to the end of my days.
生まれてから死ぬまで
from the cradle to the grave

content: 《g》(死ぬほど)

content.content: 死ぬほどびっくりした
I was frightened to death.
死ぬほどくたびれた
I am tired to death.
死ぬほど笑った
I nearly died with laughing―I nearly laughed myself to death.
女は死ぬほど男に惚れている
She loves him to distraction.
死ぬほど辛い思いをした
I had an experience as bitter as death.
死ぬような目に逢った
I looked death in the face―Death stared me in the face.

content: 《h》(死なれる)

content.content: 彼は女房に死なれた
He has had his wife die―He has lost his wife―He has buried his wife―He is mourning for his wife.
君を死なせはせぬ
You shall not die.

content: 《i》(死ぬ覚悟)

content.content: 僕は死ぬ覚悟だ
I am prepared to die―prepared for death.
人はいつでも死ぬ覚悟でいるものだ
A man should always be prepared for death.
死ぬ覚悟で遂行する
I am determined to do or die.
今度来る時は死ぬ覚悟で来い
Make your will before you come!
死ぬる覚悟で来たわいな
I come prepared to die.

content: 《j》(死にたい)

content.content: 死んでしまいたい
I wish I were dead―I wish myself dead―I feel like dying.
死にたくなった
I am sick of life.
故郷に帰って死にたい
I wish to live to see my native land.
百年後の日本を見て死にたい
I should like to live to see Japan a hundred years hence.
まだ死にたくない
I do not feel like dying yet.

content: 《k》(死にやすい、死に難い)

content.content: 人は死にやすい
Man has a frail life.
猫は死に難い
The cat is hard-lived―tenacious of life.

content: 《l》(死ぬ生きる)

content.content: 彼は死ぬか生きるかの境だ
He hangs between life and death―His life hangs in the balance.
娘はあの人と一緒になれなけりゃ死ぬの生きるのと言っている
She talks of dying if she can not marry him.

content: 《m》(俚諺)

content.content: 死ぬる子は眉目好し
Fair is the child that is doomed to early death―“Whom the gods love, die young.”
死ねば死に損生きれば生き得
To die is as much lost; to live is so much gained.
死ねば万事帳消し
“Death pays all debts.”

content:
しぬく〔仕抜く〕
〈他動〉To exhaust; to drain a cup to the dregs

content.content: 道楽を仕抜く
to drain the cup of pleasure to the dregs
苦労を仕抜く
to drain the cup of bitterness to the dregs

content:
じぬし〔地主〕
〈名〉A landlord; a land-owner; a landed proprietor

content.content: 大地主
a great land-owner
(議会などの)地主派
the landed interest

じぬり〔地塗り〕
〈名〉The first coat (of paint or plaster)

じねつ〔地熱〕
〈名〉The subterranean heat

content:
じねん〔自然〕
〈名〉Nature

content.content: 自然岩
a live rock―a living rock
自然生
wild growths

じねんじょう〔自然生〕
〈名〉The wild yam

content:
しの〔篠〕
〈名〉A small kind of bamboo

content.content: 篠突く雨
a pelting rain
雨は篠突くばかり
The rain pelts.

しのう〔子嚢〕
〈名〉［植物］A spore-case; a sporangium

しのうこうしょう〔士農工商〕
〈名〉The samurai, the farmer, the mechanic, and the merchant; the military, agricultural, industrial, and mercantile classes; the four estates of the realm (of the old regime)

content:
しのぎ〔凌ぎ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: しのぐ〔凌ぐ〕
これだけ有れば一時しのぎがつく
I can tide over the crisis―bridge over the difficulty―with this sum―(他動詞構文にすれば)―This sum will help me to tide over the crisis―bridge over the difficulty.
寒さしのぎにちょっと一杯
Let us take a wee drop to keep out the cold!
暑さしのぎの氷水
Iced―water to keep out the heat.
ほんの御空腹おしのぎです
What I offer you is only to stay your stomach for a time.
この本は退屈しのぎに好い
The book will serve to kill time.
これで当座のしのぎになる
This will serve as a temporary makeshift―a stop―gap.

content:
しのぎ〔鎬〕
〈名〉The moulding (on a sword)

content.content: 鎬を削る
to fight fiercely with swords―(より)―dispute fiercely―fight it out
両派は議会で鎬を削った
The two parties fought it out in the house.

content:
しのぐ〔凌ぐ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=耐える)to endure; to bear; to stand

content.content: 暑さをしのぐ
to stand the heat―(防ぐの意味なら)―keep out the heat
寒さをしのぐ
to stand the cold―(防ぐの意味なら)―keep out the cold
暑さより寒さの方がしのぎ好い
Cold is easier to stand―easier to bear―than heat.
酷暑しのぎ難し
The intense heat is unendurable―past endurance―past bearing―not to be borne―unbearable.
朝夕はしのぎ好くなりました
The mornings and evenings are getting cooler.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 空腹をしのぐ
to satisfy one's appetite―stay the stomach
兵は生米を噛って空腹をしのいだ
The men satisfied their appetite on raw rice.
ほんの御空腹おしのぎです
What I offer you is only to stay the stomach for a time.
退屈をしのぐ
to relieve the tedium―beguile the tedium―beguile the time―while away the time―kill time―occupy one's attention
どうして退屈をしのぐか
How do you kill time?―What do you occupy your mind with?
この本は退屈しのぎに好い
The book will serve to kill time.
退屈しのぎには読書に限る
Reading is a good kill―time―a great resource.
風波をしのぐ
to brave the wind and waves
船は風波をしのいだ
The ship braved the wind and waves―braved the elements.
不幸をしのぐ
to bear up under misfortune―hold up under misfortune―have fortitude under misfortune

content: 2. (=防ぐ)to keep out (the heat, the cold, the rain); to keep off (danger, rain); to keep away (hunger, etc.)

content.content: 寒さをしのぐにはちょっと一杯
A wee drop to keep out the cold.
暑さをしのぐには氷水
Iced-water to keep out the heat.
西洋人は多く軽井沢へ行って暑さをしのぐ
Most foreigners pass the summer at Karuizawa―go to Karuizawa for the summer.
暑さをしのぐには海水浴が一番だ
The seaside is the best place to pass the summer―Sea―bathing is the best way to pass the summer.
熱海へ行って寒さをしのごう
I will pass the winter at Atami―go to Atami for the winter.
飢渇をしのぐ
to keep off starvation―keep hunger away―“keep the wolf from the door.”
飢渇をしのぎ得れば足る
I only wish to keep the wolf from the door.
雨露をしのぐ
to keep out the rain―keep off the rain―shelter oneself (from the rain)―take shelter (from the rain)
屋根にて雨露をしのぐ
The roof shelters us from the rain.
ほんのあばら屋でようやく雨露をしのぐというだけだ
It is a tumble―down cottage that will barely keep out the rain―barely shelter you from the rain.
どうかこうか雨露だけはしのいでいる
We live under a roof―We have a roof over us―We have something to live under―We are under cover.
彼らは雨露もしのげない
They have no shelter―no roof over their heads―nothing to shelter them from the rain.
神社に寝て一夜の雨露をしのいだ
I took shelter in a shrine for a night―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A shrine afforded me shelter for a night.
船は島蔭に避難して暴風をしのいだ
The ship lay under the lee of an island during the storm―took shelter from the storm under the lee of an island.

content: 3. (=過ごす、打勝つ)to get over, tide over, bridge over (a difficulty); to hold out, stand out (a crisis); to ride out, weather out (a storm); to come through, pull through (a danger or an illness)

content.content: 困難をしのぐ
to get over a difficulty―tide over a difficulty―bridge over a difficulty―weather (out) a difficulty
この困難をしのげば後は楽だ
If we tide over this difficulty, we shall be in smooth water.
これらの困難をしのいで進んだ
We advanced amidst all these difficulties.
危機をしのぐ
to hold out a crisis―stand out a crisis―weather (out) a crisis―tide over a crisis
この危機をしのげば銀行は安全だ
If we hold out this crisis, the bank is safe.
これだけ有れば一時はしのげる
I can tide over the crisis―bridge over the difficulty―With this sum―(他動詞構文にすれば)―This sum will help me to tide over the crisis―bridge over the difficulty.
不景気には月給取りの方が商人よりもしのぎやすい
Salaried people can tide over bad times better than tradespeople.
船が暴風雨をしのぐ
A ship rides out a storm―weathers (out) a storm.
本船は暴風雨をしのいで出港した
We put to sea amidst the storm.
病気をしのぐ
to come through an illness―pull through an illness
今度の病気はしのげるつもりだ
I hope I shall pull through.
あの医者にかかって病気をしのいだ
The doctor pulled me through.
その日をしのぐ
to live―keep body and soul together―keep the wolf from the door
月百円では一家五人がその日をしのいで行けぬ
A family of five can not live on 100 yen a month.
彼らは貧乏でその日がしのげぬ
They are too poor to keep the wolf from the door.
彼らはやっとその日その日をしのいでいる
They barely manage to live on from day to day―keep body and soul together.
これだけ米があれば今月だけはしのげる
This rice will last us through the month.
これだけ薪があればこの冬はしのげる
This fuel will last us through the winter.

content: 4. (=越える)to rise above (the clouds)

content.content: 頂上は雲を凌ぐ
The summit rises above the clouds―towers above the clouds―soars above the clouds.
コンドル鳥は雲を凌いで飛揚する
The condor soars above the clouds.
彼の声は暴風雨の音を凌いで聞こえた
His voice was to be heard above the din of the storm.

content: 5. (=凌駕する)to surpass (the others in some quality); to exceed (the others in quantity or number); to distance, outdistance (one's rival); to outdo, outrival, outstrip, outshine, eclipse, efface, extinguish (the others); to throw (the others) into the shade; to get ahead of (the others)

content.content: 象は力量においてすべての動物を凌ぐ
The elephant surpasses all other animals in strength.
ロンドンは大きさや人口において他の大都会を凌ぐ
London exceeds all other cities in size and population.
彼は英語では全級を凌いでいる
He is ahead of his class in English.
彼は今に先生を凌ぐだろう
He will soon outdo his teacher―outshine his teacher―eclipse his teacher.
彼は競争者を優に凌いだ
He has far distanced his rivals―far outdistanced his rivals―soared above his rivals.
彼の名声は先輩を凌いでいる(先輩は顔色無しだ)
He has thrown his seniors into the shade.
老人は壮者を凌ぐ勢いだ
The old man outdoes the young―effaces the young―extinguishes the young.
その豪奢王侯を凌ぐ
They vie with royalty in splendour.

content: 6. (=侮る)to slight; to defy; to set (anything) at defiance; to set (anything) at nought; to hold (people) cheap

content.content: 長者を凌ぐものでない
You should not slight your superiors.
上を凌ぐ
to defy authority―set authority at naught
彼は凌がれているいるような人じゃない
He is not the man to suffer his authority to be set at naught.
あの男は人を凌ぐふうが有る
He is apt to hold people cheap.
梅は雪を凌いで咲く
The plum tree blossoms in defiance of the snow.

しのごのいう〔四の五の言う〕
〈自動〉To grumble; to complain

content:
しのつく〔篠突く〕
〈形〉Pelting

content.content: 篠突く雨
pelting rain
雨は篠突くばかり
The rain pelts.

content:
しののめ〔東雲〕
〈名〉Dawn

content.content: 紅染むる東雲
the rosy―fingered dawn

content:
しのばせる〔忍ばせる〕
〈他動〉To secrete; to hide; to conceal

content.content: 木の陰に身を忍ばせた
I hid behind a tree.
彼は懐に匕首{あいくち}を忍ばせていた
He had a dagger concealed in his bosom.

content:
しのばれる〔偲ばれる〕
〈受動〉To be recalled to one's mind

content.content: この石垣を見ると昔が偲ばれる
These stone-walls remind us of the past―carry our minds back to the good old times―These stone-walls are reminiscent of the past.
なんにつけかにつけ死んだ女房が偲ばれた
Everything reminded him of his dead wife―Everything put him in mind of his lamented wife.

content:
しのび〔忍び〕
〈副〉Incognito (incog.―と略す); in disguise

content.content: お忍びの皇族
a prince incog
殿はお忍びで市中を歩かれる
My lord walks about the city in disguise.
折々お忍びで遊びに行かれる
He occasionally pays a surreptitious visit to the gay quarters.

しのびあい〔忍び会い〕
〈名〉A clandestine meeting, a stolen interview, assignation (between lovers)

content:
しのびあう〔忍び会う〕
〈自動〉To meet in secret

content.content: 二人は人目を忍んで忍び会った
The lovers met in secret―arranged clandestine meetings.

content:
しのびあし〔忍び足〕
〈名〉Stealthy steps; soft steps; a cautious tread:(=で) stealthily; softly; on tiptoe

content.content: 忍び足で室内へ入った
I stealthily entered the room―I stole into the room.
忍び足で廊下を通った
I passed through the passage on tiptoe―I tiptoed through the corridor.

content:
しのびいる〔忍び入る〕
〈自他動〉To steal in; to slip in; to break in

content.content: 僕の寝室に忍び入った者がある
Somebody stole into my bedroom.
賊が人家に忍び入る
A burglar breaks into a house―(泥棒の符牒では)―cracks a crib.
引窓から忍び入ったらしい
He must have entered by the skylight.

しのびがえし〔忍返し〕
〈名〉Chevaux de frise

content:
しのびこむ〔忍び込む〕
〈自他動〉→『

content.content: しのびいる〔忍び入る〕

content:
しのびすがた〔忍び姿〕
〈名〉Disguise:(=で) in disguise

content.content: 殿はお忍び姿で市中をお歩きになった
My lord used to walk about the city in disguise.

しのびづま〔忍び妻〕
〈名〉A kept mistress

しのびづま〔忍び夫〕
〈名〉A lover; a paramour

content:
しのびでる〔忍び出る〕
〈自他動〉To steal out; to slip out

content.content: 家を忍び出る
to steal out of the house

しのびなき〔忍び泣き〕
〈名〉Silent tears:(=する) to shed silent tears; to sob

content:
しのびぬ〔忍びぬ〕
〈他動〉Can not bear (to do something); can not find it in one's heart (to do something)

content.content: その惨状は見るに忍びなかった
I could not bear to see the horrors―The sight was appalling.
彼の懇願を拒むに忍びなかった
I could not find it in my heart to refuse his entreaty.
彼の困るのを見捨てるに忍びなかった
I could not find it in my heart to leave him in the lurch.
仲間と別れるに忍びなかった
I could not tear myself from my companion.
彼は言うに忍びないような醜行を恬として恥じぬ
He is not ashamed of such scandalous conduct as I can not bear to mention.
そんなことをするのは情において忍びない
I have not the heart to do such a thing.
袖手傍観するに忍びず
I can not look on with folded arms.
去るに忍びぬ
I am unwilling to leave.

しのびやかに〔忍びやかに〕
〈副〉Secretly; in secret; stealthily; by stealth

content:
しのびよる〔忍び寄る〕
〈自他動〉To steal up (to a person or a place)

content.content: 抜き足差し足忍び寄る
He steals up on tiptoe.

しのびわらい〔忍び笑い〕
〈名〉Suppressed laughter; a stifled laugh:(=する) to suppress a laugh; to stifle a laugh; to laugh in one's sleeve

content:
しのぶ〔偲ぶ〕
〈他動〉
1. To think of (the past); to call (anything) to mind; to recall (anything) to one's mind

content.content: 昔を偲ぶ
to think of the past―call the past to mind
古人を偲ぶ
to think of the dead―recall the dead to one's mind
吉野の春に南朝の昔を偲ぶ
The cherry―blossoms of Yoshino remind one of the old Nancho-days.
偲ばせる、偲ばれる
to make one think of anything―remind one of anything―put one in mind of anything―recall anything to one's mind
この石垣を見ると昔が偲ばれる
The stone―walls remind us of the past―carry our minds back to the old times―They are reminiscent of the past.
なにつけかにつけ死んだ女房が偲ばれた
Everything reminded him of his dead wife―Everything put him in mind of his dead wife.
未亡人は嫁入支度を見ると昔が偲ばれた
The wedding―gown reminded the widow of her happier days―It was a reminder of her happier days.
城内は昔を偲ばせる物に満ちている
The castle is full of reminders of the past―instinct with souvenirs of the past.
この本を読むと著者の苦心が偲ばれてならぬ
Whenever I read this book, the author's labours will force themselves on my mind.
一輪の花に自然の面影が偲ばれる
Nature can be seen in a single flower.

content:
しのぶ〔忍ぶ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=我慢する)to bear, endure, stand (pain); to tolerate, suffer (one's insolence); to support (hardships); to put up with, make shift with (poor fare); to submit to (ill-treatment); to bear up under, hold up under (misfortune); to pocket, swallow, stomach (an insult); to be patient of (control, etc.)

content.content: 苦痛を忍ぶ
to bear pain―endure pain
この苦痛は忍ばれぬ
The pain is unendurable―past endurance―past bearing―not to be borne―unbear―able.
血の通う人間には忍べない
It is more than flesh and blood can bear.
難儀を忍ぶ
to endure hardships―support hardships―bear one's cross―suffer
こんな艱難は忍び難い
Such hardships are insupportable―unendurable―past endurance.
憂き目を忍ぶは人たるものの身
It is man's lot to suffer.
あの男の無礼は忍べない
I can not tolerate his insolence―suffer his insolence―His insolence is intolerable―insufferable.
暑さを忍ぶ
to endure the heat―bear the heat―stand the heat
暑さより寒さの方が忍びやすい
I can stand cold better than heat.
不自由を忍ぶ
to put up with privations―rough it
新開地へ行くなら不自由を忍ぶ覚悟でなくてはならぬ
If you are going to a new country, you must be prepared to rough it.
人民はそんな圧制には忍べぬ
The people can not endure such oppression―The people are impatient of such tyranny.
恥を忍ぶ
to endure obloquy―put up with contumelies―drug one's sense of shame―eat dirt―eat crow―eat humble―pie
彼は恥を忍んで敵の世話になった
He ate humble―pie, and received assistance at his enemy's hands.
恥を忍んで本懐を遂げるのが真の勇気
If a man puts up with wrongs and contumelies in order to attain his cherished object, he has genuine courage.
屈辱を忍ぶ
to submit to humiliation―put up with humiliation―eat humble―pie
侮辱を忍ぶ
to pocket an insult―swallow an insult―digest an affront―sit down with an affront
こんな侮辱はとても忍べない
I can not stomach such an affront.
虐待を忍ぶ
to submit to ill―treatment―put up with ill―usage
不幸を忍ぶ
to bear up under misfortune―hold up under misfortune―have fortitude under misfortune
たいがいのことは忍ぶが冷笑されるのだけは忍べぬ

content:

〈名〉Rule; sway; domination; government; control; management; direction:(=する) to rule (over a people or a country); to sway (the minds of men); to dominate (the world); to govern (a people or a country); to control (one's actions); to manage (a business); to direct (the proceedings); to preside over (man's destiny)
