content:
しぼう〔志望〕
〈名〉Desire; aspiration; ambition:(=する) to wish; to desire; to aspire to (some honours) ; to be ambitious of (excellence, etc.)

content.content: 僕は軍人志望だ
I wish to be a soldier―I aspire to military honours―I am an aspirant to military honours.
外交官志望だ
I wish to be a diplomat―I aspire to diplomatic honours―I am an aspirant to diplomatic honours.
商人志望だ
I wish to be a merchant―I aspire to commercial honours―I am an aspirant to commercial honours.
志望者
an aspirant to some honours―an applicant for entrance―a candidate for a position
軍人志望者が多い
There are many aspirants to military honours.
帝国大学志望者はたくさんある
There are many applicants for entrance to the Imperial University.
この地位の志望者は多い
There are many candidates for this position.
教員志望者がたくさんある
There are a great many would-be teachers―prospective teachers.
志望の学校
the school of one's choice
志望の学科
the subject of one's choice―the desired subject of study

content:
しぼう〔死亡〕
〈名〉Death; decease:(=する) to die; to decease

content.content: 死亡者
(一人なら)the deceased―(多数なら)―the dead
この病は死亡者が多い
This disease takes a high death toll.
死亡者数
the number of deaths
死亡率
death-rate―mortality
死亡統計
statistics of mortality
死亡届
a notice of death
死亡診断書
a certificate of death
(新聞の)死亡記事
obituary

content:
しぼう〔脂肪〕
〈名〉Fat:(動物脂肪)adipose:(豚の脂肪)lard:(牛羊の脂肪)suet:(鹿の脂肪)grease:(鯨の脂肪)blubber; speck

content.content: 脂肪に富んだ肉
fatty meat
彼は脂肪太りだ
He is obese―corpulent.
脂肪過多
excess of fat―obesity―corpulence
脂肪質の
fatty―adipose―sebaceous
脂肪組織
adipose tissue
脂肪蓄積
accumulation of fat
脂肪変性
fatty degeneration
脂肪腺
a sebaceous gland
脂肪酸
fatty acids
脂肪心
a fatty heart
脂肪油
grease

content:
じほう〔時報〕
〈名〉A review

content.content: 東洋時報
the Eastern Review

しほうがき〔仕方書〕
〈名〉A recipe, a receipt (for a dish, etc.)

content:
しほうけん〔司法権〕
〈名〉Judicial power; jurisdiction; the sword of justice

content.content: 司法権を行う
to exercise judicial power―exercise jurisdiction
支那は外国人に対して司法権が無い
China has no jurisdiction over foreigners.

しほうじかん〔司法次官〕
〈名〉The Vice-Minister of Justice

content:
じぼうじき〔自暴自棄〕
〈名〉Desperation; despair; self-abandonment:(=する) to grow desperate; to abandon oneself to despair

content.content: 失恋の結果彼は自暴自棄に陥った
Disappointed in love, he abandoned himself to despair.
これは不幸には違い無いが自暴自棄を起こしてはいけない
It is true this is a misfortune, but you must not give yourself up to despair―become desperate.

しほうしょう〔司法省〕
〈名〉The Department of Justice; the Judicial Office

しほうだいじん〔司法大臣〕
〈名〉The Minister of (State for) Justice

しほうはい〔四方拝〕
〈名〉The New Year's Religious Service at Court

content:
しほうはっぽう〔四方八方〕
〈名〉Every (possible) direction; every (possible) quarter:(=に) in every direction; in all directions:(=から) from all quarters; on every side

content.content: 鉄道は四方八方へ通じている
The railways cross the country in every direction.
鉄道は都から四方八方通じている
The railways radiate from the capital in all directions.
四方八方から人が集まって来た
People came flocking from all quarters.
四方八方から囲まれた
We were surrounded on every side.
敵は四方八方へ逃げた
The enemy went flying in all directions.

content:
しぼうりつ〔死亡率〕
〈名〉Death-rate; mortality

content.content: 死亡率は千人に対し五十人である
The death-rate is 50 per 1,000.

content:
しぼむ〔凋む〕
〈自動〉To wither; to droop; to fade; to wilt

content.content: 花がしぼんだ
The flowers have withered―drooped―faded―wilted.

content:
しぼり〔絞り〕
〈名〉Spot-dyeing:(=の) spot-dyed

content.content: 絞りの浴衣
a spot-dyed bath-gown
鳴海絞
spot-dyed Narumi fabric

content:
しぼりぞめ〔絞り染〕
〈名〉Spot-dyeing

content.content: 絞り染めにする
to spot-dye cloth

content:
しぼる〔絞る〕
〈他動〉To press; to express; to wring; to strain; to squeeze

content.content: 手拭を絞る
to wring a towel
手拭を固く絞る
to wring a towel dry
着物を絞る
to wring out clothes
着物は絞るように濡れている
The clothes are wringing wet.
水を絞る
to wring out the water
汁を絞る
to press out the juice―express the juice―squeeze out the juice―crush out the juice
葡萄の汁を絞る
to press the juice from grapes
蜜柑の汁を絞る
to squeeze the juice from an orange―squeeze an orange
膿を絞る
to press the matter from a boil―force out the purulent matter
汗を絞る
to wring out the sweat―(大汗をかくの意味なら)―sweat profusely
涙を絞る
to wring tears from one―strain a tear
金を絞る
to squeeze money from one―wring money from one―screw money out of one―bleed one
女が男を絞られるだけ金を絞った
She bled him for all he was worth.
声を絞る
to strain one's voice
心から絞り出した言葉だ
The words were wrung from his heart.
声を絞って歌う
to sing in a strained voice
幕を引き絞る
a gather a curtain
帆を絞る
to brail up a sail
枝を絞る
to bind up the branches―tie up the branches
智慧を絞る
to rack one's brains―ransack one's brains―beat one's brains―cudgel one's brains―fillip one's wits―tax one's ingenuity draw on one's resources
無い智慧を絞った
I ransacked what brains I had.
労働者の膏血を絞る
to squeeze the workmen―sweat labour
貧民の膏血を絞る
to grind down the poor―grind the faces of the poor―put the screw on the poor―put the poor under the screw
油を絞る
to take it out of one―have it out of one
英語の試験には油を絞られた
The English paper had it out of me.
今度こんなことをしたら油を絞ってやる
If he repeats it, I'll give it him.
先生にうんと油を絞られた
He gave me a sound rating―I got a severe rating.

content:
しぼる〔搾る〕
〈他動〉

content.content: 牛乳を搾る
to milk a caw

content:
しほん〔資本〕
〈名〉Capital; fund; stock

content.content: 資本を投ずる、資本を卸す
to invest capital in an enterprise―sink capital in an undertaking―lay out capital in some work
彼は鉱山に資本を投じている
He has sunk his capital in mines.
十万の資本をその事業に投じた
He invested 100,000 yen in the enterprise.
(金主となって)事業に資本を供給する
to finance a scheme
商売をするなら資本を出してやる
If you engage in business. I will furnish you with capital.
資本を運転する
to employ capital
彼は巧みに資本を運転する
He employs his capital with skill.
いくらヘマにいっても資本を棒に振るだけのことだ
I can but lose my capital at the worst.
信用は資本なり
Credit is a capital.
彼は経験という資本がある
He has his experience to draw upon.
資本無しに商売をする
to do business without capital―“makes bricks without straw”
彼は資本無しの商売だ
He lives by his wits.
手始めの資本
something to start with
ここに手始めの資本が千円有る
Here is 1,000 yen to start with.
手始めの資本無しにかかった
I had nothing to start with.
資本に手をつけぬ
to keep the capital intact
資本に手がつかぬ
The capital remains intact.
資本と労働の争闘
strife between capital and labour
固定資本
fixed capital
流動資本
floating capital―circulating capital
営業資本、運転資本
working capital―a working fund
会社の資本
the stock―the capital stock―of a company
資本家
a capitalist―a financier
資本主義
capitalism

content:
しほんか〔資本家〕
〈名〉A capitalist a financier

content.content: 資本家は労働者と折合わぬ
The capitalist is at odds with the labourer.

content:
しま〔縞〕
〈名〉Stripes; striped cloth:(=の) striped

content.content: 縞柄
a striped pattern
縞の財布
a striped money-bag
縞の着物
a striped gown
弁慶縞
checks―checkers―chequers

content:
しま〔島〕
〈名〉
1. An island; an isle:(小島)an islet:(=の) insular

content.content: 松島の湾内には幾百という島が点在する
The Bay of Matsushima is studded with hundreds of islets.
島には松が生えている
Pine-trees grow on the islets―The islets are crowned with pines.
佐渡ケ島には金鉱がある
There is a gold-mine in the Island of Sado.
船は島蔭に避難した
The ship lay under the lee of an island.
島人
an islander
島国
an insular country
日本は島国だ
Japan is an island empire.
島国根性
an insular spirit―insular ideas―insular prejudices―insularism
取りつく島も無い
to be thrown upon one's own resources
君にそう言われると僕は取りつく島も無い
You throw me upon my own resources.
取りつく島も無く泣き寝入った
Helpless to do anything, we let the matter drop.
鳥無き島の蝠蝙
“The one-eyed is king in the kingdom of the blind.”
彼は鳥無き島の蝠蝙で威張っている
He holds up his head like the one-eyed in the kingdom of the blind.

content:
しま〔揣摩〕
〈名〉Guess; conjecture; surmise; speculation:(=する) to guess; to conjecture; to surmise; to speculate (on a matter)

content.content: 彼の意は容易に揣摩するあたわず
His intention is hard to conjecture.
揣摩臆測
speculation
この問題については種々の揣摩臆測を試むる者あり
Some people speculate on the subject.

content:
しまい〔仕舞〕
〈名〉
1. End; close; termination; conclusion; finish:(=の) last; final:(=に) last (of all); finally; at last; in the end; conclusion

content.content: もうこれでおしまいよ
This is all―There is no more.
金はこれでおしまいだ
This is all the money left.
品物はこれでおしまいだ
These are all the goods left.
雪はこれでもう今年はおしまいだろう
We shall have no more snow this year.
話が下へ下がったらおしまいだ
When the talk comes down to the dregs, it is at an end―it is over.
試験はおしまいだ
The examination is over―The examination is at an end.
悪口を言い出しては議論はたいがいおしまいだ
When it comes to calling names, argument is pretty nearly at an end.
こうなっちゃおしまいだ(万事休す)
All is over―All is up.
肺病にかかっちゃおしまいだ
When one is attacked with consumption, it is all over with one―it is all up with one.
人間もああなっちゃおしまいだ
He is beyond hope―past all hope―a gone case.
しまいから二番目
the last but one
しまいから三番目
the last but two
しまいまで
to the end―to the last
僕の言うことをしまいまで聞いて下さい
Hear me to the end!―Hear me out!
しまいまで忠義を立て通したのが四十七名
Forty-seven men remained faithful to the last.
この狂言はしまいまで見よう
I will sit out the play.
僕は芝居をしまいまで見ていられない
I can not sit out a play.
始めからしまいまで
from beginning to end―from first to last―from start to finish
この詩は始めからしまいまで暗記している
I know the whole poem by heart from beginning to end.
彼は始めからしまいまで忠義を立て通した
He remained faithful from first to last.
その勝負を始めからしまいまで見ておった
I saw the contest from start to finish.
しまいに
last of all
しまいに来た人(を―the man who came last―と言わずして次の如くに言う)
the last man who came (= the last comer)
彼はしまいに来た
He was the last man who came―the last man to come―the last to come.
彼はいつも誰よりも先に来てしまいに帰る
He is always the first to come and the last to go.
船が沈没する時に船長が一番しまいに船を去る
The captain is the last man to leave a sinking ship.
彼はしまいに(終りに臨んで)こう言った
In conclusion, he said―He concluded by saying―He concluded with these words.
しまいになる
(事なら)to end―come to an end―be finished―be over―(物なら)―run out―be all gone
試験はじきにしまいになる
The examination will soon come to an end―The examination will soon be over.
試験がおしまいになった
The examination is at an end―The examination is over.
休暇はじきおしまいになる
The holidays will soon come to an end―The vacation draws to a close.
金がおしまいになった
The money has run out―The money is out―The money is all gone.
あの品はもうおしまいになりました
We have run out of the article―We are out of the article―The article is out of stock.
仕事をおしまいにしようね
Let us leave off work!
これでおしまいにしよう
We will leave off here.
今日は早じまいにしよう
Let us leave off early today.
しまいには(結局)
in the end
しまいにはどうせ皆俺の厄介になるのだ
They all come to me in the end.
悪いことをするとしまいには顕れる
Murder will out in the end.
しまいには実力が勝つ
Real ability wins in the long run.
始め人を欺き欺きするとしまいには己を欺くようになる
If you begin by deceiving others, you will end by deceiving yourself.
しまいには妥協になった
The matter ended in a compromise.
しまいにはどうなることやら
How will it all end?―Whither will all this lead?

content: 6. (=身仕舞)toilet

content.content: おしまいをする
to make one's toilet
女はおしまいをしている
She is at her toilet.

content: 7. (=能の仕舞)an informal No dance

しまい〔姉妹〕
〈名〉A sister; sisters

content.content: 異母姉妹
half-sisters
異父姉妹
uterine sisters
実の姉妹
sisters german
姉妹のような愛
sisterly love
姉妹艦
a sister-ship

しまいかん〔姉妹艦〕
〈名〉A sister ship; sister ships

しまいぎしゃ〔仕舞汽車〕
〈名〉The last train

content:
しまいぎわに〔仕舞際に〕
〈副〉Near the end

content.content: その役者は幕のしまいぎわに出る
The actor appears near the end of the act.
援兵は戦いのしまいぎわに来た
The reinforcements arrived near the end of the battle―when the battle was near its end―at the eleventh hour.

content:
しまいこむ〔仕舞込む〕
〈他動〉To stow away

content.content: 本は押入へしまい込んで開いたことが無い
His books are stowed away in the press, and never opened.

しまいもの〔仕舞物〕
〈名〉(=本などの仕舞物)The remainder

content:
しまう〔仕舞う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=終る)to finish; to get through with (one's task); to leave off (work)

content.content: 今日は仕事をしまった
I have finished my day's work―(は英、米は)―I am through for today.
今日はもうしまおう
Let us leave off work!
仕事をしまってまず安心
I am glad the work is off my hands.
もう試験をしまった
The examination is at the end―The examination is over.
店を仕舞う
(夜に入ってなら)to shut up for the night―close―(閉店の意味なら)―shut up shop
今晩はもうしまいました
We have shut up for the night.
銀行は三時にしまう
The bank closes at three.
今頃は店をしまう時分だ
It is closing time now.

content: 3. (=蔵める)to put away; to lay away; to stow away; to lock away; to keep

content.content: 金を仕舞え
Put away the money!
着物は樟脳を入れてしまってある
The clothes are laid away with camphor―(西洋では)―laid away in lavender.
本は押入へしまい込んで開いたことが無い
The books are stowed away in the press, and never opened.
証券は金庫へしまっておいた
I have locked the instruments away in the safe.
貴重品は倉にしまってある
The valuables are locked away in the go-down.
君は大事な物をどこへしまっておくか
Where do you keep your valuables?
大事にしてしまっておく
to treasure anything―keep anything under lock and key
宝物は大事にしまってある
The treasure is kept under lock and key.

content:
しまう〔了う〕
〈他動〉To finish; to get through with (one's task)

content.content: この本を読んでしまった
I have finished reading―done reading―this book.
もう飯を食ってしまった
I have finished eating―done eating.
仕事をしてしまったら行く
I am coming as soon as I finish my work―as soon as I get through with my task.［注意］「何々してしまった」の「しまった」を Perfect Tense をもって表すを常とす。
この本を皆読んでしまった
I have read all these books.
金を使ってしまった
I have spent the money.
金をやってしまった
I have given away the money.
稽古の始まるまでには書いてしまう
I shall have written it by the time school begins.
明日までには仕事をやってしまう
I shall have finished my work by tomorrow.
仕事を今日中にやってしまわなければならぬ
I must get my work finished in the course of the day.
じきにやってしまう
I will get it down in no time.［注意］「何々してしまう」の「しまう」を形容詞 (all) 副詞 (up) をもって表すことあり。
金を使ってしまった
I have spent all the money.
米を食ってしまった
We have eaten up the rice.
酒を飲んでしまった
We have drunk up the wine.
薪を焚いてしまった
We have burnt up the fuel.
紙を使ってしまった
I have used up the paper.
戸を釘詰めにしてしまう
to nail up a door
箪笥を封じてしまう
to seal up the cabinet［注意］語勢を強めるのみの「しまう」は概して英語に訳さず。
死んでしまえ
Die!
彼は死んでしまった
He is dead (and gone).
彼は行ってしまった
He is gone.
金が無くなってしまった
The money is gone.
畳んでしまえ
Down with him!

content:
じまえ〔自前〕
〈名〉(A geisha's) independence (of her mistress)

content.content: 自前になった
She has become independent―become her own mistress―set up for herself.
自前で稼いでいる
She is working for herself―working on her own account.

content:
しまかげに〔島蔭に〕
〈副〉Under the lee of an island

content.content: 船は島蔭に避難している
The ship lies under the lee of an island.

しまがら〔縞柄〕
〈名〉A striped pattern

content:
しまぐに〔島国〕
〈名〉An insular country

content.content: 日本は島国だ
Japan is an island empire.

しまぐにこんじょう〔島国根性〕
〈名〉An insular spirit; insular ideas; insular prejudices; insularism

content:
しまだ〔島田〕
〈名〉The shimada coiffure; a dress coiffure (of girls)

content.content: 島田に結う
to do one's hair in shimada
島田娘
a girl in shimada

しまだい〔島台〕
〈名〉An ornamental stand (used at weddings)

content:
しまつ〔始末〕
〈名〉
1. (=次第、顛末)the case; circumstances; state of things

content.content: こんなわけになった始末を聞いてくれ給え
I will relate the circumstances that led to this state of things.
事の始末はこういう次第です(一通りお聴き下さい)
This is how it happened.
子どもが多いものだからご覧の通りの始末です
We have so many children that you see the state we are in.
こんな始末だからとても我が家で勉強などはできません
Such being the case, it is impossible for me to study at home.
とうとうこんな始末になってしまった
Things have come to this (pass).
一年経たぬにこの始末
A year has not elapsed before things have come to this.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は細君から小遣いのあてがいを貰っている始末だ
He is reduced to receiving an allowance of pocket-money from his wife.
友人から金を借りる始末だ
I am reduced to borrowing money from my friends.
遺族は売り食いをしている始末だ
His family is reduced to living by selling their property.
もう売る物も無い始末だ
They have nothing more to sell.

content: 2. (=処理、処分)management; disposal:(=する) to manage (a matter); to dispose of (anything); (what) to do with (anything); to deal with (anything); to take care of (anything); to secure (one's possessions, etc.)

content.content: どうか始末をつけよう
I will manage it somehow.
ビール一ダースくらいは僕でも始末をつける
I can manage a dozen bottles of beer myself.
去る前にこの家の始末をつけなけりゃならん
I must dispose of my house before leaving this place.
その子どもをどう始末したのか
How have you disposed of the child?―What have you done with the child?
子どもの始末に困っている
I do not know what to do with the child―I am at a loss how to dispose of the child.
あの女は始末し切れぬほど男を持っている
She has more lovers than she can deal with.
あの男は僕には始末ができない
I can not deal with him―I can do nothing with him―I do not know what to do with him.
始末にいけない奴だ
He is hard to deal with―an ugly customer―an awkward customer to deal with.
この病は始末におえぬ
This disease is hard to deal with―intractable.
金の始末をしなさい
You must take care of the money.
彼は我が身の始末もできない
He can not take care of his own welfare.
娘どもは自分の始末ができる
The girls can take care of themselves.
自分のことは自分で始末すると新しき女が言う
The new woman says that she can manage her own affairs―look out for herself.
後の始末は俺がする
I will set matters right.

content: 3. (=節約)frugally; thrift:(=する) to be saving of (one's money); to be frugal of (one's expenses)

しまつしょ〔始末書〕
〈名〉A written account of one's conduct

content.content: 始末書を取られた
I was required to give in an account of my conduct on the occasion.

content:
しまった
〈間投詞〉Hang it!; Damn it!; Dang it!; Confound it!

content.content: しまった、紙入を置いて来ちまった
Hang it! I have left my pocket-book at home.
しまったことをした
I have done it!
これはしまった
The game is up.

content:
しまつにいけない〔始末にいけない〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: しまつにおえぬ〔始末におえぬ〕

content:
しまつにおえぬ〔始末におえぬ〕
〈形〉Hard to deal with; awkward (to deal with); unmanageable; unruly; intractable; refractory; incorrigible

content.content: 始末におえぬ奴だ
He is hard to deal with―an awkward customer to deal with―an ugly customer.
この病は始末におえぬ
This disease is hard to deal with―intractable.
生蛮は始末におえぬ
The aborigines are hard to deal with―refractory.
この馬は暴れて始末におえない馬だ
This horse is a restive and unruly beast.
この機械は重くて始末におえぬ
This machine is heavy and unmanageable.
あれは始末におえない嘘つきだ
He is an incorrigible liar.

content:
しまながし〔島流し〕
〈名〉Exile; banishment; transportation

content.content: 島流しにする
to exile a criminal to an island―banish a criminal to an island―transport criminal to an island
島流しになる
to be exiled to an island―banished to an island―transported to an island

content:
じまま〔自儘〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: きまま〔気儘〕
わがまま〔我儘〕

しまもり〔島守〕
〈名〉The governor of an island

content:
しまり〔締り〕
〈名〉
1. (=緊縮)tightness; firmness; compactness

content.content: 締まりの無い体格だ
He is of loose build.
締まりの無い肉
flabby flesh―flaccid flesh
締まりの無い顔だ
He has a pudding face.
締まりの無い口元だ
He has a weak mouth―an indecisive mouth.
彼は口に締まりが無い
He has a loose tongue―He is indiscreet.
口に締まりがある
He is discreet.
あの人は締まりの無いふうをしている
He has a slouched air.
あの女は身に締まりが無い、行いに締まりが無い
She is loose in conduct―loose in morals―indiscreet―wanton.
身に締まりがある
She is discreet.
彼は身に締まりがある、身に締まりが無い
He is prudent―imprudent.
あれは締まりの無い男だ、心に締まりが無い
He is a weak character―He needs winding up―He wants screwing up.
締まりの無い文章
a loose style
彼はどうかすると言行に締まりが無くなる
He is apt to let himself loose.

content: 2. (=節約)frugality; thrift

content.content: 彼はずぼらで締まりが無い
He is slovenly and thriftless.

content: 3. (=戸締り)fastening

content.content: 戸に締まりをする
to fasten the door―make fast the door―secure the door―lock (and bolt) the door
戸は厳重に締まりがしてある
The door is securely fastened―locked and bolted.
窓の締まりをしておけ
Fasten the windows―Secure the windows.

content:
しまりや〔締り屋〕
〈名〉A thrifty person; a tight-fisted man; a close man; a miser

content.content: あれはなかなか締り屋だ
He is very tight-fisted.

content:
しまる〔締まる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=閉ざさる)to shut, be shut; to close, be closed

content.content: もう門が締まった
The gate is already shut.
戸が締まっている
The door is shut.
この戸はなかなか締まらない
This door will not shut―This door shuts hard.
戸が独りで締まった
The door closed of itself.

content: 2. (=緊縮する)to tighten; to be tight; to be firm; to be compact

content.content: 締まった体格だ
He has a compact frame―a well-knit frame.
締まった顔だ
He has a well-set face.
締まった口元だ
He has a firm mouth―a decisive mouth.
締まった肉合
firm flesh
締まった文章
a compact style
心が締まっている
He has a firm character―a firmness of character.
寒いと身が締まる
Cold braces (the body)―invigorates (the body).
身の締まるような空気
bracing air―crisp air
靴が締まって足が痛い
My shoes draw.

content: 3. (=まじめになる)to become steady; to steady (down); to sober (down)

content.content: 遊ぶ時は遊んでも締まる時は締まる
A young man who sows his wild oats, will become steady in time―A young man sobers down in time―“Young sinner, old saint.”
若い時は遊んでも年を取って締まればよい
Sow your wild oats while you are young, and sober down with age!

content: 4. (=節約する)to be frugal; to be thrifty; to be saving; to retrench

content.content: 彼は金使いが締まっている
He is saving of his money―frugal of his expenses.
あなたは金使いがあまり荒いからちとお締まりになってはいかがですか
You are too extravagant. Hadn't you better retrench a little?

content:
じまわり〔地廻り〕
〈形〉
1. (=近在の)from the surrounding country

content.content: 地廻り卵
eggs from the surrounding country

content: 2. (=海岸通いの)coasting

content.content: 地廻り船
a coasting vessel―a coaster

content:
じまん〔自慢〕
〈名〉Boast; brag; vaunt; pride; vanity:(=する)(口でなら)to boast (of one's skill); to brag (of one's deeds); to vaunt (one's deeds):(心でなら)to be proud of (one's birth); to be vain of (one's looks); to take pride in (one's profession); to pride oneself on, value oneself on, pique oneself on, plume oneself on, peacock oneself on (one's tact):(=の) boasted; vaunted

content.content: 彼は自慢する癖がある
He is given to boasting.
彼は学問が自慢らしい
He seems to pride himself on his attainments.
英語なら僕も自慢だ
I pride myself on my English myself.
彼が子どもを自慢するのももっともだ
He may well be proud of his boy.
あの息子なら自慢になる
He is a boy to be proud of―The boy does him credit.
あんな息子を持ったって自慢にならぬ
Such a boy does him no credit.
あれが父親の自慢息子だ
He is his father's pride.
あの手際なら自慢になる
The performance does him credit―It is a feather in his cap.
あんな手際では自慢にならぬ
Such performance does him no credit.
これが彼の自慢の作だ
This is his vaunted work.
彼はその事件を隠すどころかかえって自慢にしている
He makes no secret of the affair. He rather makes a boast of it.
自慢じゃないが好い娘だ
Without boasting I may say she is a good girl―She is a good girl, though I say it who should not.
彼はお国自慢だ
He is proud of his country―He takes a pride in his country.
力自慢だ
He prides himself on his strength.
喉自慢だ
He prides himself on his good voice.
男自慢だ
He is vain of his good looks―He plumes himself on his personal advantages.
あの女は器量自慢だ
She is vain of her good looks―She plumes herself on her charms.
自慢高慢ばかのうち
Boastful pride is a sort of folly.
卑下も自慢の中
Too much humility is a sort of pride.

content:
じまんばなし〔自慢話し〕
〈名〉A boastful talk; a brag; braggadocio

content.content: 自慢話しをする
to boast―brag―talk boastfully
自慢話しをする人
a boastful man―a boaster―a braggart
いざとなると自慢話しをした奴が真先に逃げ出した
In the moment of danger, the braggart was the first to run away.

content:
しみ
〈名〉A stain; a blot; a blotch; a smut; a smudge

content.content: 酒が着物のしみになる
Wine leaves a stain on clothes.
着物にしみができる
One's clothes become stained.
この品はちょいとしみが有るだけで無キズです
The article is free from blemish, except for a slight stain.
しみを抜く
to take out a stain―remove a stain
このしみはなかなか抜けない
This stain will not come out.

content:
しみ〔衣魚〕
〈名〉The clothes-moth

content.content: 衣魚の食った着物
moth-eaten clothes

content:
じみ〔地味〕
〈形〉Plain (dress); sober (pattern); quiet (colour); unostentatious (ways); unpretentious (life); conservative (method); not showy

content.content: 彼は地味な支度をしている
He is soberly dressed―plainly dressed―quietly dressed.
地味な色
a quiet colour―a sober colour
地味な柄
a quiet pattern―a sober pattern
地味に暮らす
to lead a quiet life―live an unpretentious life
あの人はやり方が地味だ
He has unostentatious ways―conservative methods.
この地は地味な代りに持ちます
This stuff does not make a good show, but it wears well.

content:
しみこむ〔染み込む〕
〈他動〉To soak into (the soil); to infiltrate into (a rock); to sink into (one's mind); to penetrate into, strike into (the marrow); to percolate through (sand); to permeate (a rock); to begrime (the skin); to imbue (one's mind); to infect (one's mind); to impregnate (one's mind)

content.content: 雨が土に染み込む
The rain soaks into the soil.
寒さが骨髄に染み込む
The cold penetrates into the marrow―strikes into the marrow.
油絵の絵の具が画布に染み込む
The oil-colours sink into the canvas.
彼の言葉が深く心に染み込んだ
His words sank deeply into my mind.
水が岩に染み込む
The water permeates the rock.
岩に水が染み込んでいる
The rock is permeated with water.
机にインキが染み込んでいる
The desk is begrimed with ink.
あの人は垢が染み混んでいる
He is begrimed with dirt.
この外套は雨が染み込む
This overcoat lets the rain through.
彼の心には新思想が染み込んでいる
His mind is imbued with new ideas.
彼らの心には先生の教訓が深く染み込んでいる
Their minds are deeply impregnated with their master's teachings.
あの女は花柳界の悪風が身に染み込んでいる
She is infected with the vices of the frivolous community.

content:
しみじみ〔染々〕
〈副〉Deeply; heartily; seriously; quietly

content.content: しみじみいやになった
I am heartily sick of it―sick at heart.
思う事がかなわないとしみじみいやになる
“Hope deferred maketh the heart sick.”
つくづく考えてしみじみいやになった
I have thought oneself sick at heart.
その道理がしみじみわかりました
The truth has come home to my heart.
ご意見がしみじみ胸にこたえました
Your words have gone home to my heart.
彼の言葉がしみじみ嬉しかった
His words touched my heart.
彼の言葉がしみじみと身にしみた
His words sank deeply into my mind.
しみじみ恥ずかしく思います
I feel deeply ashamed.
まだしみじみお話も致しません
I never had a quiet talk with him.
しみじみ話をする暇も無かった
I have no time to have a quiet talk with him.
しみじみ言い聞かした
I talked seriously to him.

content:
しみず〔清水〕
〈名〉
1. Clear water; crystal water
2. (=清泉)a spring; a fountain

content.content: 野中の清水
the Fountain of the Plains

content:
じみち〔地道〕
〈名〉
1. (=馬の地道)foot's pace

content.content: 馬に地道を踏ませる
to make a horse go at foot's pace

content: 2. (=正道)the right path; the beaten track:(=な) honest; upright

content.content: 地道を踏む
to tread the right path―follow the beaten track―tread one's shoes straight―draw a straight furrow―live on the square
地道を踏んで行きさえすりゃ間違い無い
“The beaten path is the safest.”
あれは地道な人だ
He is an honest man―an upright man.

content:
しみったれ
〈名〉A miser; a niggard; a skinflint; a scrape-penny; a screw; a curmudgeon:(=た) miserly; stingy; niggardly; mean; close; close-fisted; near; tight

content.content: あのしみったれめ
The curmudgeon!
そんなしみったれたことを言うな
Don't say such mean things!―Don't be so mean!

content:
しみでる〔滲み出る〕
〈自動〉To ooze; to exude; to transude; to drain; to percolate

content.content: 汗が皮膚からしみ出る
Perspiration oozes―exudes―transudes―through the skin.
フランネルを洗って掛けて置くと水がしみ出る
Hang up the flannel to drain.

content:
しみとおる〔滲み通る〕
〈他動〉To soak through, pierce through, penetrate through (anything)

content.content: 雨が外套をしみ通った
The rain has soaked through my overcoat.
汗が上衣までしみ通った
The sweat has soaked through my coat.
寒さが着物をしみ通る
The cold pierces through―penetrates through―my clothes.

しみゃく〔支脈〕
〈名〉A mountain-spur; an offset

content:
しみる〔染みる〕
〈他動〉To sink into (one's mind); to touch (one's heart); to imbue (one's mind); to impregnate (one's mind); to infect (one's mind)

content.content: 身に染みる
to sink into one's mind―touch one's heart―come home to one's heart
彼の言葉がしみじみと身に染みた
His words sank deeply into my mind.
ご親切が身に染みて嬉しい
Your kindness touches my heart―touches me to the heart.
ご教訓は身に染みました
Your teachings have come home to my heart―I am deeply impressed with your teachings.
この経験が身に染みた
The experience has touched me to the heart―touched me to the quick.
貧乏の味が身に染みた
Poverty has touched me to the quick―pierced me to the quick.
彼の一言が身に染みた
His word has come home to my heart―sunk into my inmost soul.
今度は借金の味を身に染みて覚えた
I find to my cost―I now know to my cost―I have learned to my sorrow―what it is to be in debt.
相談相手の欠乏を身に染みて感ずる
I keenly feel the want of an adviser.
彼は仕事が身に染みない
He has no heart for his work.
今度は身に染みて仕事をするようになった
He begins to put his heart into his work―He now works with a will.
身に染みてありたがい
I am deeply thankful to you for it.
ご親切身に染みてかたじけのうございます
I am deeply thankful for your kindness.
このことは身に染みて忘却致しません
I have the fact deeply impressed on my mind.
彼の心には新思想が染みている
His mind is imbued with new ideas.
彼らの心には先生の教訓が染みている
Their minds are impregnated with their master's teachings.
あの女は花柳界の悪風が染みている
She is infected with the vices of the frivolous community.
不良少年は悪に染みている
The hooligans are steeped in vice.

content:
しみる〔凍る〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: こおる〔凍る〕

content:
しみる〔滲みる〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=ひりひり痛む)to smart

content.content: この目薬は目にしみる
The eye water smarts.
目にしみる
The eye smarts.
この薬は傷にしみる
The lotion smarts―The lotion makes the wound smart―The wound smarts with the lotion.
葱をむくと目にしみる
The peeling of onion makes one cry.

content: 2. (=浸透する)to pierce; to penetrate

content.content: 身にしみる
to pierce the body―penetrate the body
北風が身にしみる
The north wind cuts the skin.
身にしみる風
a cutting wind
寒さが着物を通してしみる
The cold pierces through my clothes―penetrates through my clothes.
身にしみる寒さ
biting cold

content:
じみる〔染みる〕
〈接尾動詞〉To look like (something); to have a touch of (something); to have a dash of (something)

content.content: あの人は田舎じみている
He looks like a countryman.
言語挙動が気違いじみている
He shows a touch of insanity in his speech and behaviour.
気違いじみた真似を止せ
Don't behave like a madman!
日本の書生は天竺浪人じみたところがあったものだ
The Japanese student used to have a dash of the Bohemian about him.
彼は年寄りじみている
He is old before his time.
垢じみた顔
a grimy face―a begrimed face

content:
しみわたる〔染み渡る〕
〈他動〉To spread through (every part); to pervade (all); to thrill through (one)

content.content: この悪風が社会全般に染み渡っている
The moral taint pervades all classes of society.
身に染み渡る
to thrill through one―A thrill runs through one
身に染み渡る鶴の一声
Your gracious words thrill through me―send a thrill through me.
その嬉しさが五臓六腑に染み渡る、はらわたに染み渡る
The joy thrills me to the heart's core.

content:
しみん〔四民〕
〈名〉The four estates; the estates of the realm; all classes of people

content.content: 諸税は平等に四民にかかる
The weight of taxation bears equally on all the classes.

しみん〔四眠〕
〈名〉The fourth sleep of the silkworm

content:
しみん〔市民〕
〈名〉The townspeople; the townsfolk; the townsmen:(一人なら)a townsman; a burgess

content.content: 市民権
burgess rights
市民権を得る
to be made free of the city

content:
じむ〔事務〕
〈名〉Business; business routine; business matters; affairs; the duties of an office; the charge of an office

content.content: 事務上のことはいっさい幹事に一任してある
All business matters are committed to the care of the manager.
事務をとる、事務を扱う
to carry on business―conduct business―transact business―manage affairs―attend to the duties of an office
彼は事務をとっている
He is carrying on business―at his desk.
日曜に事務をとりますか
Do you carry on business on Sunday?―Is business carried on on Sunday?―Is the office open (for business) on Sunday?
日曜には事務をとりません
Business is not carried on on Sunday―The office is closed (to business) on Sunday.
銀行は日曜に事務を扱いますか
Does the bank transact business on Sunday?―Is the bank open (for business) on Sunday?
日曜には事務を扱いません
The bank is closed (to business) on Sunday.
事務がはかどる
Business makes good progress.
事務が停滞する
Business is delayed.
事務多忙
We are pressed with business.
事務多端のため手が廻らぬ
Things are left undone owing to press of business―We are hampered by pressure of business.
事務に忙殺されている
We are being worked to death.
事務を取締る
to control the affairs―manage the affairs
事務を管理する
to administer the affairs―manage the affairs
事務を引継ぐ
to take over charge of an office―take over the duties of an office
事務を引渡す
to hand over the charge of an office―hand over the duties of an office
彼は事務の才がある
He has a talent for business―He possesses business ability.
事務に通じている
He is versed in business.
事務を扱うことが上手だ
He is skilful in conducting business―skilful in managing affairs.
よく事務の上がる男だ
He is quick in the despatch of business.
事務の勝手を呑込まなければならぬ
You must get the run of business―master the business routine.
役所の事務を見習う
to learn the business routine of an office―learn the duties of an office―get the run of office-business
お役所の事務は繁文縟礼の嫌いがある
Office-business is open to the charge of red-tapism.

content:
じむいん〔事務員〕
〈名〉A clerk; an office-clerk:(総称すれば)the clerical staff of an office; the office force

content.content: 女子事務員
a female clerk―an office girl

content:
じむか〔事務家〕
〈名〉A man of business; a man of affairs:(事務の才のある人の意味なら)a man of business ability

content.content: あの人はなかなかの事務家だ
He possesses great business ability.

じむか〔事務課〕
〈名〉The general affairs section

じむかん〔事務官〕
〈名〉An administrative official; a secretary

content:
しむけ〔仕向け〕
〈名〉
1. (=人に対する行いや待遇)treatment; one's conduct (towards another):(=る) to treat (one well or ill); to act (well or ill) towards (one); to deal (well or ill) by (one); to do (well or ill) by (one)

content.content: そのように仕向けたなら誰でも逃げてしまう
Such treatment would drive away anybody.
女が男にすげなく仕向けた
She acted coldly towards him.
先の仕向け方がひどいから怒るのだ
I am angry, for he has dealt harshly by me.
彼は誰にでも好く仕向ける
He does well by everybody―He treats everybody well.
日本は戦争をしなければならないように仕向けられた
The war was forced upon Japan.

content: 2. (=発送)forwarding:(=る) to forward

content.content: 荷物を仕向ける
to forward the good to a person or a place
仕向け地、仕向け先
the destination
仕向け港
the port of destination

content:
じむしつ〔事務室〕
〈名〉The office

content.content: この室は事務室に使える
The room will serve for the office.
この室は事務室に使っている
This room serves as the office.

content:
じむしょ〔事務所〕
〈名〉An office; one's place of business; business premises

content.content: 法律事務所
a lawyer's office―(英国にては)―an attorney's office

じむしょ〔寺務所〕
〈名〉The office of a temple

じむちょう〔事務長〕
〈名〉(=汽船の事務長)The purser

content:
しめ〔〆〕
〈名〉
1. (=〆高)the total; the sum-total

content.content: 〆をする
to add up the figures―sum up the figures―count up the items―total the figures―cast up accounts

content: 2. (=紙十束)a ream (of a hundred quires)

しめ
〈間投詞〉I've got it!; Capital!; How good!

content.content: 明日は休みか、しめしめ
No school tomorrow. Capital!

content:
しめ〔注連〕
〈名〉
1. (=注連縄)→『

content.content: しめなわ〔注連縄〕
しめかざり〔注連飾り〕

しめ〔蝋嘴〕
〈名〉The hawfinch; the grosbeak

content:
しめい〔使命〕
〈名〉A mission

content.content: 使命を負う、使命を帯びる
to be charged with a mission
使命を帯びて行く
to go on a mission
使命を帯びて派遣される
to be sent on a mission
使命を果たす
to perform one's mission
使命を全うする
to fulfil one's mission
東西の思想を融合させるのは日本の使命である
It is Japan's mission to reconcile Eastern and Western ideas.

content:
しめい〔指名〕
〈名〉Nomination:(=する) to nominate; to name; to mention (one) by name

content.content: 人を指名する
to name the person―mention a person by name
指名してはいかん
You must not mention names.
議長が委員を指名する
The president nominates the members of a committee.
彼は後任に指名された
He was nominated for successor―named as successor.
指名して人を呼ぶ
to want one by name
指名されたから間違いはありません
There can be no mistake, for he wanted you by name.

content:
しめい〔死命〕
〈名〉Life or death; fate

content.content: 死命を制す
to decide one's fate―have a hold upon one―have a grip upon one―have another at one's mercy―have another in one's power
彼の死命を制している
I have a hold upon him―have a grip upon him―He is at my mercy―in my power.
敵に死命を制せらる
to be at the mercy of the enemy―in the power of the enemy
高利貸から金を借りると死命を制せられる
If you borrow money from a usurer, you will be at his mercy.
彼にこの事を知られると死命を制せられる
If he knows the fact, I shall be at his mercy―His knowledge of the fact will place me in his power―His knowledge of the fact will give him a hold upon me.
敵の死命を制するはこの時なり
Now is the time to decide the fate of the enemy.

content:
しめい〔氏名〕
〈名〉Name and surname; one's full name; a name

content.content: 氏名を詐称する
to assume a false name
氏名不祥の人
a man of unknown name―a man of unknown identity
氏名を点呼する
to call the roll
氏名点呼
a roll-call

content:
じめい〔自明〕
〈形〉Self-evident

content.content: 自明の理
a self-evident truth―a truism―an axiom
この事実は自明だ
The fact is self-evident―The fact speaks for itself.

しめいてんこ〔氏名点呼〕
〈名〉A roll-call

しめうり〔占め売り〕
〈名〉Cornering the market:(=する) to corner the market (and sell at a great profit)

しめかざり〔注連飾り〕
〈名〉The New Year's decorations (outside the door)

content:
しめがね〔締金〕
〈名〉A buckle

content.content: 胴締めの締め金を掛ける
to buckle one's belt
締め金をはずす
to unbuckle one's belt

content:
しめきり〔締切〕
〈名〉
1. Closing

content.content: 投票締切
closing of the vote
米国行郵便は午後六時締め切り
The American mail closes at 6 p. m.
懸賞文の募集は今月三十日締め切り
The invitation of prize essays closes on the 30th inst.
予約は締め切りになりました
The term of subscription has closed.
申込は締め切りです
The time for application has closed.
投稿は今月三十日締め切り
Contributions will be declined after the 30th of this month.
締切日
the closing day
編輯を締め切りにする
to go to press
締切時間
the closing hour―the time of going to press―the appointed time
編輯締め切りまではまだなんらの報告無し
No report has yet been received up to the time of going to press―at this writing.
締め切りまでには書いてしまう
I shall have finished writing by the time of going to press.
締め切りまでにはできる
It will be ready by the appointed time.
(この戸)締切
Not to be opened―Closed.
戸を締め切りにする
to shut up a door―close up a door

content:
しめきる〔締切る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=戸などを締切る)to close up (a door); to shut up (a gate)

content.content: 裏門はいつも締め切ってある
The back entrance is always kept shut.

content: 2. (=事務などを締切る)to close (business, the list, etc.)

content.content: 規定の額に達すれば募集を締め切る
The invitation will be closed when the full amount is reached.
寄付募集を締め切る
to close the subscription list
もう募集を締め切ろう
We will close the list―The list it nearly full.
土曜には銀行は正午限りで締め切る
On Saturday, the banks close at noon.
編輯を締め切る
to go to press
もう投稿を締め切ろう
We will decline further contributions.

content:
しめくくり〔締め括り〕
〈名〉
1. (=心の締まっていること)firmness of character

content.content: あの男は心に締めくくりがある
He has firmness of character―a firm character.
締めくくりの無い男だ
He lacks firmness of character―He is a weak character.

content: 2. (=管理、監督)control; supervision; superintendence

content.content: 事務の締めくくりをする人が無ければならぬ
There must be some one to superintend the business.
締めくくりをする人が無いと事務が乱れる
Absence of supervision will throw the business into disorder.
締めくくりが無いからこんなことになったのだ
Want of control has brought things to this.

content:
しめくくる〔締め括る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=崩れぬように締めて括る)to hold together

content.content: 箍{たが}で桶側を締めくくる
The hoops hold the staves together.
支那は国が大き過ぎてこれを締めくくる一つの魂が無い
China is too large for one spirit to hold her together.

content: 2. (=管理する、監督する)to control; to superintend; to supervise; to oversee

content.content: 事務を締めくくる人が無ければならぬ
There must be some one to superintend the business.
締めくくる人が無いと事務が乱れる
Want of supervision will throw the business into disorder.
大勢の人を締めくくっていくのは骨だ
It is hard work to keep many people under control.
一々干渉せずに大本を締めくくっていればよい
Instead of interfering in everything, you need only keep the prime mover under control.

しめころす〔締め殺す〕
〈他動〉To strangle; throttle (a man)

content:
しめし〔示し〕
〈名〉An example

content.content: 君がそんなことをすると他の者に示しがつかない
If you do such a thing, it will be a bad example to others―The others will follow your example―Your conduct has influence on others.

content:
しめし〔襁褓〕
〈名〉Swaddling-bands; swaddling clothes; long clothes

content.content: 赤子をしめしに包む
to swaddle a baby

content:
しめしあわせ〔示し合わせ〕
〈名〉Concert:(=る) to concert (a plan)

content.content: 手筈を示し合わせる
to concert a plan of operations
互いに示し合わせてその電報を打たせたのだ
The telegram was sent by concert.
こりゃ示し合わしてしたことに違いない
The whole thing must have been done by concert.
二人は示し合わして家出をした
They left home by concert―in concert with each other.
五年級が四年級と示し合わしてストライキをやった
The Fifth Year went on strike in concert with the Fourth Year.

content:
しめじめ
〈副〉Damply

content.content: しめじめ降る
It drizzles―It mizzles.

じめじめした
〈形〉Damp (walls); dank (air); sodden (ground)

content:
しめす〔示す〕
〈他動〉To show; to indicate; to point; to betoken; to denote; to signify; to manifest; to evince; to tell; to testify to, bear witness to (a fact)

content.content: 実験は好成績を示す
The experiment shows good results.
このことは彼の無罪なることを示す
The fact shows that he is innocent―testifies to his innocence―bears witness to his innocence.
戦意を示す
to show fight
路を示す
to point the way
彼の人相は精力あることを示す
His physiognomy indicates that he has energy―His physiognomy is indicative of energy.
時計は時間を示す
The clock tells the hour.
晴雨計の下がるのは雨天を示す
The falling barometer betokens rainy weather―denotes rainy weather.
下がった目尻は好色なることを示す
Down-turned eyes signify sensuality.
彼は去らんとする意を示した
He signified his intention of leaving.
彼はその地位を得たき意を示した
He manifested ［evinced］ a desire to secure the position.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 威を示す
to make a demonstration
寒暖計は九十度を示す
The mercury registers―records―reads―stands at―90°.
良心や理性の示す処に従う
to obey the dictates of conscience or reason
模範を示す
to set one an example―set an example to others
悪例を示す
to set a bad example to others
暗に示す
to hint a way―suggest a plan
彼にその方法を暗に示した
I hinted the way to him.
忠勇なる汝有衆に示す
We do hereby make proclamation to Our loyal and brave subjects that...

content:
しめす〔湿す〕
〈他動〉To moisten; to wet; to soak

content.content: 手拭を湿す
to moisten a towel
手拭を湿して持って来い
Bring me a moist towel!
喉を湿す
to wet one's whistle―wet one's clay
海綿を湿す
to soak a sponge

content:
しめた〔占めた〕
〈間投詞〉I've got it!

content.content: しめたぞ
I am sure of my game―I am sure of success―I am sure of it.
君はもうしめたもんだ
You are on the high road to success―You are in a fair way to succeed―You have the ball at our feet.

content:
しめだか〔〆高〕
〈名〉The total; the sum-total; the total amount

content.content: 〆高はいくらになるか
What do you make the total?

content:
しめだし〔締め出し〕
〈名〉Shutting out; barring out:(職工に対する締め出し)a lockout

content.content: (英国の学校にて)先生に締め出しを食わせる
to bar out the teacher
締め出しを食う
to be shut out―barred out―locked out―on the wrong side of the door
昨夜締め出しを食った
I got the key of the street last night.

しめだす〔締め出す〕
〈他動〉To shut out, bar out, lock out (a man)

content:
じめつ〔自滅〕
〈名〉Self-destruction:(=する) to destroy oneself:(=的) self-destructive; suicidal

content.content: 自滅を図る
to destroy oneself―cut one's own throat―pull down one's house about one's ears
そんなことをすりゃ自滅だ
It is cutting your own throat.
あんなことをすりゃしまいには自滅する
He will end by pulling down his house about his ears.
自滅策
a suicidal policy

content:
しめっぽい〔湿っぽい〕
〈形〉Damp; dampish; dank; moist; wet; humid

content.content: 入梅になると家の中が湿っぽくなる
All is damp in the rainy season.
湿っぽい空気
humid air
湿っぽい天気
wet weather
そりゃ湿っぽい話だ
That is a tearful story.

content:
しめなわ〔注連縄〕
〈名〉The sign of the Japanese taboo, a taboo-rope (consisting of a rope with tufts of straw and paper at intervals)

content.content: 注連縄を張る
to stretch a taboo-rope―taboo a space

content:
しめやか
〈形〉Quiet; soft; gentle; lonely; melancholy

content.content: しめやかな雨の夜
a quiet rainy night
雨がしめやかに降る
It rains softly and gently.
しめやかに暮らす
to lead a quiet life―live a lonely life
しめやかに語る
to have a quiet talk with one
しめやかな歌
a melancholy song

content:
しめり〔湿り〕
〈名〉
1. (=湿気)damp; moisture; humidity

content.content: 糸に湿りをくれる
to moisten the yarn
糸に湿りがある
The yarn is moist.
火薬に湿りがあって発火しなかった
The powder was damp, and did not ignite.
この火薬は湿りが無い
The powder is dry.
日本は湿りがちだ
Japan has a humid climate.
湿りがちな話だ
It is a tearful story.
彼女は湿り声で物語った
She told her story in a tearful voice.

content: 2. (=降雨)a rain

content.content: 好いお湿りだ
It is a welcome rain.

しめりけ〔湿り気〕
〈名〉Damp; dampness; moisture

content:
しめる〔〆る〕
〈他動〉To add up, sum up, run up, total (the figures); to count up (the items); to cast up (accounts)

content.content: 勘定を〆る
to cast up accounts
勘定は〆て五十円になります
The accounts total 50 yen.
〆ていくらになるか
What do you make the total?
〆て百円
Total 100 yen.
〆て百
One hundred in all―One hundred all told―One hundred in the aggregate.

content:
しめる〔湿る〕
〈自動〉To dampen; to become damp; to moisten; to become moist; to become humid; to become wet

content.content: 湿っている
to be damp―moist―humid―wet
火薬が湿っていて発火しなかった
The powder was damp, and did not ignite.
火薬が湿らぬように
Keep the powder dry!
地が湿っているからこの辺は雨が降ったらしい
It must have been raining here, for the ground is wet.
着物が夜露で湿っている
My clothes are moist with the night-dew.
空気が湿っているから壁が乾かない
The walls do not dry, for the air is humid.

content:
しめる〔占める〕
〈他動〉
1. To occupy; to hold; to take; to have

content.content: 席を占める
to occupy a seat―hold a seat―take a seat
議員席を占める
to hold a seat in the Diet
上席を占める
to occupy the seat of honour―take the top-seat―sit at the top
誰よりも上席を占める
to take precedence of―take rank of―take the pas of―some one
彼はいつも級の首席を占めている
He is always at the top of his class.
地位を占める
to occupy a position―hold a position―have a position
彼は好地位を占めている
He holds a good position―He is well placed.
顧問官の地位を占めている
He holds the place of adviser.
顔役の地位を占めている
He holds the place of leader of his set.
地の利を占める
to occupy an advantageous position―hold vantage-ground
日本の海軍は世界で第三位を占めている
The Japanese navy holds the third place―stands third on the list―Japan, as a naval power, takes the third place in the world―ranks third in the world.
英国は海軍国中で第一位を占めている
England holds the first place among the naval powers―England stands first on the list of naval powers―England is at the head of naval powers.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼の名は筆頭第一を占めている
His name heads the list―leads the rest.
社会に地歩を占める
to gain a footing―get a footing―obtain a footing―in society
利を占める
to make a profit―realize a profit―reap profits
彼はこの事業で巨利を占めた
He realized an enormous profit by the enterprise.
政友会は議会で多数を占めている
The Seiyukai commands a majority in the House.
始め陸海軍は薩長が多数を占めていた
At first, men of Satsuma and Choshu extraction predominated (over the rest) in the army and navy.
支那貿易の大部分は日本人が占めている
A great part of Chinese trade is in the hands of Japanese―in Japanese hands.
彼の所有地はその郡の大部分を占めている
His estate covers the greater part of the district.
婦人が聴衆の大部分を占めていた
Women formed the greater part of the audience.
棒給が経費の大部分を占めている
The salaries claim the greater part of the expenditure.
職工に支払う賃銀は総額の五割を占めている
Labour claims 50 percent of the total expenses.
味を占める
to form a taste for anything
読書の味を占める
to form a taste for reading
一度読書の味を占めたら止められぬ
Once a reader, always a reader.
甘言の味を占める
to drink deep of flattery

content: 〈自動〉To have got it; to be sure of one's game; to be sure of success

content.content: しめた
I've got it.
しめたぞ
I am sure of my game―I am sure of success―I am sure of it.
君はもうしめたもんだ
You are on the high road to success―You are in a fair way to succeed―You have the ball at your feet.

content:
しめる〔締める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=閉ざす)to shut (a door); to close (a gate); to shut up (a house)

content.content: 戸を締めろ
Shut the door!
窓を締めましょうか
Shall I shut the window?―close the window?―let down the window?
この戸を締めておけ
Keep the door shut!
入って後を締めろ
Come in, and shut the door after you!
戸をピシャンと締める
to shut the door with a bang―bang the door―slam the door
門は十時に締める
The gate is shut―The gate is closed―at ten.

content: 2. (=緊縮する)to tighten; to make tighter:(より)to wear (a girdle)

content.content: 帯を締める
to tighten one's belt―(ただ帯をするの意味なら)―gird oneself―fasten one's clothes with a girdle―wear a girdle
あの女は立派な帯を締めている
She wears a fine girdle.
褌を締める
to tighten one's loin-cloth―(奮発するの意味なら)―brace oneself―gird oneself
君は褌を締めているか
Do you wear a loin-cloth?
褌を締めてかかる
to brace oneself for an effort―gird oneself for an effort―gird up one's loins
絃を締める
to wind up the strings―screw up the strings
心を締める
to brace oneself up―screw up one's courage
喉を締める
to grip one's throat―(殺せば)―strangle one―throttle one
この襟は顎を締める
This collar strangles me.
鶏を締める
to wring a fowl's neck
靴が締めて足が痛む
My shoes draw―My shoes pinch me.
締める処は締め緩める処は緩める
to be judicious

content: 3. (=圧搾する)to press

content.content: 油を締める
to press oil―express oil―extract oil―(from seed)

content:
しめん〔四面〕
〈名〉The four sides; all sides; every side

content.content: 四面に敵を受けた
We were attacked on every side.
四面から囲まれた
We were surrounded on every side.
日本は四面皆海だ
Japan is encircled by the sea―Japan is a sea-girt land.
四面皆敵(四面楚歌の声)
I am amidst enemies.

content:
しめん〔紙面〕
〈名〉
1. (=新聞紙上の場所)space

content.content: 紙面に限りあれば詳細に亘って論及するあたわず
Limits of space―Want of space―prevents our going into details.
紙面の都合にて以下次号とす
The subject will be continued in our next number for want of space.
紙面を借りて意見を発表したし
I request your courtesy of space to publish my views.
貴重なる紙面を汚したる罪を謝す
I must apologize for trespassing upon your precious space.
紙面経済
economy of space

content: 2. (=新聞紙の大きさ)size (of a newspaper)

content.content: あの新聞は紙面を拡張した
The paper has enlarged its size.

content: 3. (=新聞紙の体裁)get-up, style (of a newspaper)

content.content: あの新聞は大いに紙面を改良した
The paper has greatly improved its style―improved its get-up.

content: 4. (=書面)a letter

じめん〔地面〕
〈名〉
1. (=地べた)the ground

content.content: 地面が濡れている
The ground is wet.
人の地面に足を踏み込む
to trespass on another's ground―(人の領分を侵すの意味なら)―encroach on another's province

content: 2. (=地所)(広ければ)land:(狭ければ)a lot; a plot:(広場内にある一区の地面は)a patch

content.content: 地面を借りる
to lease land―lease a piece of land
郊外に地面を持っている
I have a lot―a plot―in the suburbs.
一区の地面
a piece of land―a lot―a plot―a patch

しめんたい〔四面体〕
〈名〉A tetrahedron

content:
しも〔下〕
〈名〉
1. (=下部)the lower part; the foot; the bottom:(=の) lower; second; latter; last:(=に) below; down

content.content: 食卓の下座に坐る
to sit at the foot of the table
人の下に立つ
to stand below others―“play second fiddle”
河下
the lower reaches of the river―(に)―down the river―down stream
瀧のあるのは橋より河下だ
The falls are below the bridge.
上は王侯より下は万民に至るまで
from the prince down to the people
下半期
the last half-year
下の旬
the second line (of a couplet)

content: 2. (=下の人々)the people; one's inferiors

content.content: 上にへつらう者は下に横柄だ
Those who fawn upon their superiors, will domineer over their inferiors.
下に親しめば侮りを招く
“Familiarity breeds contempt.”
上は下を慈み下は上を敬うべし
Let people love their inferiors and honour their superiors!
下を憐む
to have compassion for one's inferiors
上に見習う下
“As is the king, so are the people.”

content: 3. (=陰部)the privy parts; the private parts; the privates; the secrets; one's nakedness

content.content: 下の病
venereal diseases
下に関する話
obscene talk―indecent talk―ribald talk―ribaldry

content:
しも〔霜〕
〈名〉Frost; hoar frost; white frost; rime

content.content: 霜が降る、霜が下りる、霜が置く
It freezes.
昨夜霜が降った
It froze last night.
霜が溶ける
The frost breaks up―It thaws.
地面は霜で真白だ
The ground is white with frost.
木の葉が霜で焼ける
The leaves are frosted―touched by frost―nipped by the frost.
霜が降ると枯れる植物がある
Frost kills some plants.
彼は頭に霜を載いている
He has frosted hair―grizzled hair―gray hair―white hair.
頭髪に霜を交えている
His hair is shot with gray.
霜を踏む
to go out in the morning
百姓は霜を踏んで出で月を踏んで帰る
The peasant goes out early in the morning, and returns home late in the evening.

content:
しもがれ〔霜枯れ〕
〈名〉Frost-blight:(=の) wintry; bleak

content.content: 霜枯れ景色
a bleak scene
霜枯れの空
a wintry sky
霜枯れの月
a wintry moon
霜枯れ時
the dead season
霜枯れ三月
the last three months of the year
私どもの商売は今が霜枯れです
My business is now at a low ebb―at a standstill.

content:
じもく〔耳目〕
〈名〉

content.content: 一億円の借款を締結する
to contract a loan of 100,000,000 yen

じゃっかん〔若干〕
〈形〉Some (money); a number of (men, etc.)

content:
じゃっかん〔弱冠〕
〈名〉Youth; twenty years of age

content.content: 為朝弱冠にして九州を平ぐ
Tametomo subdued Kyushu in his youth―at twenty (years of age)―in his twentieth year.

content:
しゃっかんだん〔借款団〕
〈名〉A consortium

content.content: 支那国際借款団
the international consortium for financing loans to China
日本も借款団に加入した
Japan entered the consortium.

content:
じゃっきする〔惹起する〕
〈他動〉To give rise to (a rumour); to lead to (a controversy); to cause (trouble); to provoke (a war, etc.)

content.content: この問題は物議を惹起するに至った
The question gave rise to a controversy.

しゃっきょう〔釈教〕
〈名〉The doctrines of Sakya; Buddhism

content:
しゃっきん〔借金〕
〈名〉A debt; a loan; liabilities; what one owes:(=する) to run into debt; to contract a debt; to incur a debt

content.content: 彼は借金がある
He owes money―He is in debt―He is behindhand with the world.
僕は借金が無い
I owe no money―I owe no one―I am out of debt―I am free from debts―I am square with the world―I am on a par with the world.
借金さえ無ければまず安心
“Out of debt, out of danger.”
無さそうであるものは借金
People will seem to be out of debt.
君はいくら借金があるか
What do you owe?―What is the amount of your debts?―What is the extent of your liabilities?
一万円借金がある
I owe 10,000 yen―I am in debt to the amount of 10,000 yen―I am indebted in the sum of 10,000 yen―I am liable for 10,000 yen.
君に借金がある
I owe you money―I owe you a debt―I am in your debt―I am in debt to you―I am indebted to you.
彼に古い借金がある
I owe him a debt of long standing.
君にいくら借金があるかね
What do I owe you?―In what sum am I indebted to you?―What is owing to you?―What is due to you?
君に十円借金がある
I owe you 10 yen―I am indebted to you in the sum of 10 yen―Ten yen is owing to you―Ten yen is due to you.
借金をする
to run into debt
彼は身分不相応なぜいたくをするから借金するのだ
He runs into debt by living above his means.
また借金でもしたのか
Are you again in debt?
借金するな
Keep out of debt!
どうかこうか借金だけはせずにいる
I manage to keep out of debt.
金を残すどころか借金をせぬというばかりだ
So far from saving money, I can barely keep out of debt.
借金をせずにいるのが関の山だ
It is all I can do to keep out of debt.
借金をせずに世を渡る
to pay one's way through the world
借金は懲り懲りだ
I know to my cost what it is to be in debt.
借金が増えるばかりだ
The debts go on increasing.
借金がかさむ
The debts swell.
方々の借金がたまった
I have run up debts.
あの店にはだいぶ借金がたまった
I have run up a long bill at that shop.
彼は借金で困っている
He is embarrassed by debts―in pecuniary difficulties.
あの人はいつも借金で苦しんでいる
He is always in difficulties.
僕が借金で困っている時伯(叔)父が助けてくれた
My uncle helped me out of my difficulties.
彼は借金で首がまわらぬ
He is deeply in debt―over head and cars in debt.
彼は借金を背負っている
He is burdened with debts―encumbered with debts―saddled with debts.
俺が借金を背負う
I will take the debt upon myself―be liable for the debt―burden myself with the debt.
人の借金まで背負ってたまるものか
How can I saddle myself with another's debts?
彼は親父の借金を背負っている
He is encumbered with his father's debts.
親父が借金を残して死んだ
His father left debts behind him.
借金を返す
to pay a debt―pay one's dues
借金を払わなければならぬ
I must pay my debts―get square with my creditors―improve my face.
もう借金を悉皆払ってしまった
I have paid off all my debts―I am now square with all the world.
借金をきれいに払ってしまう
to clear off one's debts―clear oneself from debts―free oneself from debts
この金があれば借金はきれいに無くなる
This money will clear me from debts―free me from debts.
借金をだんだん払う
to work off one's debts
借金の催促をする
to press one for payment―dun one for a debt
借金の言い訳をする
to apologize for non-payment―put off a dun
細君は借金の言い訳が上手だ
His wife shows tact in dealing with duns.
借金を踏み倒す、借金を引掛ける
to repudiate a debt―evade payment―bilk a bill―bilk a creditor
借金を質に置いても買う
I would go all lengths―go any length―to buy it.
(賭場などの)証文の無い借金
a debt of honour
彼には不義理な借金がある
I owe him a bad debt―a debt of honour.
無利子の借金
a passive debt

content:
しゃっきんとり〔借金取り〕
〈名〉A creditor; a bill-collector; a dun

content.content: 借金取りに責められる
to be dunned for debts
酒飲めばいつか
Wine maketh glad the heart of man,
心も春めきて
And makes of winter genial spring,
借金取りも
And e'en the bill-collecting dun
鶯の声
Doth to you like a robin sing.

シャーツク
〈名〉An impudent fellow; a cool hand:(女なら)a saucy girl

content:
しゃっくり〔吃逆〕
〈名〉Hiccup; hiccough:(=する) to hiccup; to hiccough

content.content: びっくりしてしゃっくりが止まった
The fright has stopped my hiccup.

〈名〉→『

content.content: はくしじゃっこう〔薄志弱行〕

じゃっこく〔弱国〕
〈名〉A weak nation; a feeble power

しゃっこつ〔尺骨〕
〈名〉The ulna

しゃっつら〔シャッ面〕
〈名〉A phiz; a mug

シャッポ
〈名〉A cap; a hat

〈名〉A younger brother

content:
しゃてい〔射程〕
〈名〉Range

content.content: 敵は射程内に在り、射程外に在り
The enemy is within range―out of range.

content:
しゃてき〔射的〕
〈名〉Shooting at a target

content.content: 射的をする
to shoot at a target
射的演習
target practice―rifle practice
射的演習をする
to practise shooting
彼は射的が上手だ、射的が下手だ
He is a good shot―a bad shot.
射的会
a shooting match
射的会に参加する
to shoot a match

しゃてきば〔射的場〕
〈名〉A target-practice ground; a rifle-range

content:
しゃとう〔社頭〕
〈名〉The front of a shrine

content.content: 社頭の松
a pine in front of a shrine

content:
じゃどう〔邪道〕
〈名〉
1. (=邪教)heresy; heterodoxy
2. (=悪道)the wrong path; evil courses

content.content: 邪道に入る
to fall into evil courses―stray from the path of duty―go astray
人を邪道に導く
to lead one astray―lead one into error―pervert one
近道をして邪道に入った
He tried to get money without working for it.

content:
しゃない〔社内〕
〈名〉The precincts of a shrine

content.content: 社内殺生禁断
Shooting and fishing prohibited within the precincts of the shrine.

content:
じゃないか
〈助動詞〉
1. ［疑問］ Isn't it?

content.content: そうじゃないか
Isn't it so?
君は知っているんじゃないか
You know, don't you?
あれは君の伯(叔)父さんじゃないか
He is your uncle, isn't he?

content: 2. ［発議］ Let us

content.content: 行こうじゃないか
Let us go―I propose that we go.

しゃにくさい〔謝肉祭〕
〈名〉Carnival

content:
しゃにむに〔遮二無二〕
〈副〉
1. (=やたらに)immoderately; inordinately; madly; to excess; like fury; like thunder; like hell; like the devil; like anything

content.content: 彼はしゃにむに勉強する
He works like fury―like thunder―like hell―like the devil―like anything.
しゃにむに食い、しゃにむに飲む
He eats to excess―drinks to excess―commits excesses.
女が男にしゃにむに惚れている
She loves him to distraction.
そうしゃにむに急ぐことは無い
There is no occasion for such mad haste.
彼は子どもをしゃにむに可愛がる
He is immoderately―inordinately―fond of his children.

content: 2. (=無理やり)forcibly; by force

content.content: 娘をしゃにむに嫁にやった
They forced her to marry―forced her inclinations.

しゃねつ〔射熱〕
〈名〉Radiant heat:(=する) to radiate heat

content:
じゃねん〔邪念〕
〈名〉Evil thoughts; wicked intentions; sinister designs

content.content: 邪念を去る
to banish evil thoughts from one's mind―purify one's mind from evil thoughts

content:
じゃのめ〔蛇の目〕
〈名〉A double-ring; a bull's-eye design

content.content: 蛇の目の唐傘
a double-ringed umbrella

content:
しゃば〔車馬〕
〈名〉Horses and vehicles

content.content: 車馬通行止
No thoroughfare for horses and vehicles.
車馬不通だ
The place is inaccessible to horse or vehicle―Communication by horse or vehicle is impossible.
車馬入るべからず
No admittance to horse or vehicle.
車馬徐行
Slow down.

content:
しゃば〔娑婆〕
〈名〉The land of the living; the world; life

content.content: お前はまだ娑婆にいたのか
Are you still in the land of the living?
苦の娑婆とはよくいったものだ
This is indeed a world of woe.
娑婆がいやになった
I am sick of life.
娑婆をふさぐ
to occupy a place in the world―live in the world
娑婆をふさぐ権利が無いように小さくなって歩いている者がある
Some people sneak about as if they had no right to a place in the world―as if they had no business to be here.
あんな奴は娑婆ふさぎだ
He is a good-for-nothing.
囚人が娑婆の人になる
A convict gets out of prison―gets free.
今度食らい込んだら二度と娑婆へ出ることはむずかしい
The next time I am in quod, I am doubtful if I shall ever get free again.

content:
しゃばっけ〔娑婆気〕
〈名〉Worldly desires

content.content: 娑婆気を捨てる
to wean the mind from worldly desires
あの男はまだ娑婆気が抜けない
He has not outlived his worldly desires yet―He is not yet above the world.

content:
じゃばら〔蛇腹〕
〈名〉(西洋家屋のは)the cornice:(暗箱のは)bellows

content.content: 蛇腹糸
parallel threads

しゃひ〔舎費〕
〈名〉Boarding expenses; boarding charges

content:
しゃふつ〔煮沸〕
〈名〉Boiling:(=する) to boil

content.content: 煮沸消毒する
to sterilize by boiling
牛乳を煮沸消毒する
to scald milk

content:
しゃぶる
〈他動〉To suck (candy); to pick (a bone); to chew (a pebble)

content.content: 飴をしゃぶる
to chew ame―suck candy
骨をしゃぶる
to pick a bone

content:
しゃへい〔遮蔽〕
〈名〉Cover; shelter; defilade:(=する) to cover, shelter, defilade (a position or a fortification)

content.content: 遮蔽物
a cover―a shelter
遮蔽陣地
a covered position―a sheltered position
遮蔽地帯
a covered zone―a sheltered zone

じゃへき〔邪僻〕
〈名〉Perverseness; crabbedness:(=ある) crabbed; perverse

content:
しゃべつ〔差別〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: さべつ〔差別〕

content:
しゃべる〔喋べる〕
〈自他動〉To talk; to chat; to chatter; to prattle; to tattle; to rattle; to twaddle; to gabble; to gibber; to wag one's tongue, wag one's jaws, wag one's chin

content.content: 唇の薄い者はしゃべる
Thin-lipped people are talkative.
彼はよくしゃべる
His tongue is constantly going―His tongue runs on continually.
よくしゃべる女だ
How she runs on!―She is a chatterbox.
しゃべる方では彼に及ぶ者は無い
He has no equal in the way of talking.
しゃべることだけは一人前だ
He counts for one, so far as talking goes.
独りでしゃべっている
He engrosses the conversation.
酒がまわるとしゃべり出す
Wine looses people's tongues.
あの男はしゃべるから秘密は話されぬ
You can not tell him a secret, for he will flab.
人をしゃべり負かす
to talk one down
ベチャベチャしゃべる
to babble―gabble―chatter―rattle
ベラベラしゃべる
to talk volubly
ゴチャゴチャとしゃべる
to twaddle
早口にしゃべる
to gibber―jabber
喋々としゃべる
to talk glibly
出まかせにしゃべる
to talk at random
のべつ幕無しにしゃべる
He talks without intermission―talks nineteen to the dozen.
三時間立て続けにしゃべった
He rattled on for three mortal hours.
油紙に火のついたようにしゃべる
He rattles on at an immense rate.
わけのわからぬことをしゃべる
to talk nonsense―talk jargon―talk gibberish
声を枯らしてしゃべっている
He is talking himself hoarse.
息を切らしてしゃべっている
He is talking himself out of breath.
顔を真赤にしてしゃべっている
He is talking himself red in the face.
口を酸っぱくしてしゃべった
I have talked my tongue weary.
口から泡を飛ばしてしゃべる
He sputters away―splutters away.
物を食いながらしゃべる
to talk with one's mouth full

じゃほう〔邪法〕
〈名〉
1. (=邪教)heresy; heterodoxy
2. (=魔法)magic; sorcery; the black art

しゃほうけい〔斜方形〕
〈名〉A rhomb; a rhombus

しゃぼてん〔仙人掌<シャボテン>〕
〈名〉The cactus; the prickly pear

しゃぼてん〔仙人掌<シャボテン>〕
〈名〉The cactus; the prickly pear

content:
しゃほん〔写本〕
〈名〉A manuscript; a written copy

content.content: その本は写本だ
The book is in manuscript.

content:
シャボン
〈名〉→『

content.content: せっけん〔石鹸〕

content:
しゃぼんあわ〔シャボン泡〕
〈名〉Soap-suds; lather

content.content: 顔(を剃る前)にシャボン泡を塗る
to lather the face

content:
しゃぼんだま〔シャボン玉〕
〈名〉A soap-bubble

content.content: シャボン玉を吹く
to blow soap-bubbles

content:
じゃま〔邪魔〕
〈名〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. Disturbance (of repose):(=する) to disturb (one's repose)

content.content: 子どもがお邪魔をしてすみません
I am sorry the children disturbed you.
勉強の邪魔をする
to disturb (one in) one's studies
お勉強のお邪魔になるかと思って入らなかった
I did not come in, lest I should disturb you in your studies.
安眠の邪魔をする
to disturb one's repose
お邪魔さま
Excuse my disturbing you!

content: 2. Interruption (of business):(=する) to interrupt (business)

content.content: 話しの邪魔をする
to interrupt (one in) one's talk
お話しの邪魔をしてすみませんが
Excuse me for interrupting you, but...
演説の邪魔をする
to interrupt (one in) one's speech
講義の邪魔をする
to interrupt (one in) one's lecture
質問して講義の邪魔をする
to interrupt a lecture with questions
君の質問は講義の邪魔になる
You interrupt the lecture with your questions―Your questions interrupt the lecture.
ここなら邪魔の入る恐れが無い
There is no fear of interruption here.
あの木が眺めの邪魔になる
That tree interrupts the view.
お邪魔さま
Excuse my interrupting you!

content: 3. Interference (with business):(=する) to interfere with (business)

content.content: 君の質問は講義の邪魔になる
Your question interfere with the lecture.
授業中談話はいかん、授業の邪魔になる
No talking in class! It interferes with the class-work.
遊びが仕事の邪魔にならぬように
Pleasure must not interfere with business.
勉強の邪魔にならないように遊べ
Let not your pleasures interfere with your studies.
職務の邪魔にならない限りは何をしてもよし
You may do anything, so long as it does not interfere with your duties.
病気が学問の邪魔になる
Illness interferes with one's studies.
君の計画は僕の計画の邪魔になる(かちあう)
Your plan interferes with mine―conflicts with mine―clashes with mine.
職人の邪魔になってはいかん
You must not interfere with the men.

content: 4. Prevention (of activity):(=する) to prevent (one from doing something)

content.content: 病気が勉強の邪魔になる
Illness prevents one from working.
身体の弱いのが活動の邪魔になった
The weakness of his constitution prevented him from taking an active part in the business of life―His weakness prevented his activity.

content: 5. A hindrance (to success):(=する) to hinder (one from accomplishing one's purpose)

content.content: 困難がたくさんあって目的を遂げる邪魔になった
Many difficulties hindered me from accomplishing my purpose.
この困難が成功の邪魔になる
This difficulty hinders success―This difficulty is a hindrance to success.
病気が勉強の邪魔になる
Illness hinders one's studies―Illness is hindrance to one's studies.
身体の弱いのが活動の邪魔になった
The weakness of his constitution hindered―proved a hindrance to his activity.
寒気は発育を邪魔する
Cold hinders growth―Cold is a hindrance to growth.

content: 6. An impediment (to progress):(=する) to impede (progress)

content.content: 軍隊の行李が行進の邪魔になる
The baggage impedes the progress of an army―The baggage is an impediment to the progress of an army.
外部の干渉が事業の進行の邪魔になる
Outside interference impedes the progress of the work―Outside interference is an impediment to the progress of the work.
身体の弱いのが活動の邪魔になった
The weakness of his constitution impeded―proved an impediment to―his activity.

content: 7. An encumbrance(to one):(=する) to encumber (one)

content.content: 僕は家族という邪魔がある
I have an encumbrance in my family―I am encumbered with a family―I wish to be disencumbered of my family.
彼は手助けどころかかえって邪魔になる
So far from being a help, he is a positive encumbrance to me.

content: 8. An obstruction (to traffic):(=する) to obstruct (traffic)

content.content: こんな物は通行の邪魔になる
It obstructs traffic―It is an obstruction to traffic.
あの木が眺めの邪魔になる
That tree obstructs the view―That tree is an obstruction to the view.
通路の邪魔を取払う
to clear the passage from obstructions

content: 9. As obstacle (to success):(=する) to stand in the way (of success)

content.content: お邪魔をしてすみません
I am sorry to stand in your way.
ご出世のお邪魔をしてはすまないから(お留め申しません)
I should be sorry to stand in the way of your advancement.
ご栄転なさるのならご出世のお邪魔をしません
If you are changing for the better, I will not stand in the way of your advancement.
君がそこに居ると邪魔だ
You stand in my way.
邪魔だから退け
Get out of my way!
この箱が邪魔だ
This box stands in the way.
邪魔だからかたづけろ
Get it out of the way!
この困難が成功の邪魔になる
This difficulty stands in the way of my success―This difficulty is an obstacle to success.
我々が添うのに邪魔になるものは無い
There is no obstacle to our union―There is nothing in the way of our union―Nothing stands in the way of our union.
身分の違いが二人の交際の邪魔になった
The difference of rank stood in the way of their intercourse―proved an obstacle to their intercourse.
彼は僕の邪魔をするつもりだ
He intends to throw an obstacle in my path.
通路の邪魔を取払う
to clear the passage from obstacles

content: 10. A bar (to progress):(=する) to bar (one from activity)

content.content: 通行の邪魔をする
to bar the way―bar the path
出入の邪魔をする
to bar egress and ingress
この困難は成功の邪魔になる
This difficulty is a bar to success―a bar in the way of my success.
外部の干渉が事業の進行の邪魔になった
Outside interference barred―proved a bar to―the progress of the work.
身体の弱いのが活動の邪魔になった
The weakness of his constitution barred him from activity―His weakness proved a bar to his activity.
身分の違いが二人の交際の邪魔になった
The difference of rank barred―proved a bar to―the intercourse of the two.
我が大望の邪魔になるものは彼一人
He is the only bar to my ambition.

content: 11. A barrier (between rich and poor)

content.content: この困難が成功の邪魔になる
This difficulty is a barrier to success.
身分の違いが二人の交際の邪魔になった
The difference of rank proved a barrier to the intercourse of the two―Rank stood a barrier between the two.
我が大望の邪魔になるものは彼一人
He is the only barrier to my ambition.

content: 12. A check (to motion or speed):(=する) to check (motion or speed)

content.content: 雪が汽車の進行の邪魔になった
The snow checked the progress of the train.

content: 13. A clog (to a person―on his movement or activity)

content.content: 女子どもは活動の邪魔になる
Women and children are a clog to an active man―a clog on a man's activity.

content: 14. A drag (to a person―on his movement or activity)

content.content: 彼の身分が出世の邪魔になった
His social station was a drag to him in rising in the world―a drag on his career.

content: 15. A drawback (to a person)

content.content: 貧は学問をする邪魔になる
Poverty is a drawback to a student.
嫉妬心は交際の邪魔になる
Envy is a drawback to friendship.

content: 16. Counterwork:(=する) to counterwork, work against (some cause)

content.content: 人の事業の邪魔をする
to counterwork one's cause―work against one's cause

content: 17. Intrusion (on one's time):(=する) to intrude on (one's time)

content.content: お忙しいところをお邪魔をしてすみません
I am sorry to intrude on your time―intrude upon your precious time.
お休みのお邪魔をしてすみません
I am sorry to intrude on your privacy.
これが船の進行の邪魔になる
This retards the progress of the vessel.
借金が運動の邪魔になる
I am hampered by debts.
財政困難が活動の邪魔になる
One is handicapped by financial embarrassment.
人の邪魔をするな
Do not cross his wishes―thwart his purpose―put a spoke in his wheel.
恋の邪魔をする
to cross one in love―thwart one in love
計画の邪魔をする
to oppose―set one's face against―a scheme
それではお邪魔に行こう
Then I will force my company upon you―inflict my company upon you.
ちょっとお邪魔さして下さい
Let me impose myself upon you for a while.
音が邪魔になって考えられん
I can't hear myself think for the noise.
恋にはなまじ連れは邪魔
Love likes no fellowship.
この子はお邪魔になりましょう
The child must be a trouble to you.
俺の仕事を邪魔する気か
Do you mean to spoil my game?
邪魔にする
to be bothered by―be bored by―anything
彼は子どもを邪魔にする
Children bother him―Children bore him.
君は僕を邪魔にするのか
Do you wish to get rid of me?

content:
19. 
〈以上の共通点〉

content.content: 人の邪魔をする
to stand in one's way―throw an obstacle in one's path―intrude on one's time―cross one's wishes―thwart one's purpose―put a spoke in one's wheel
お邪魔さま
(人の安静を妨害してなら)Excuse my disturbing you!―(人の話しや仕事で妨害してなら)―Excuse my interrupting you!―(人の行動を妨害してなら)―I am sorry to stand in your way.
勉強の邪魔
a hindrance to study―an impediment to study
勉強の邪魔をする
to disturb one in one's studies―intrude upon one's studies
勉強の邪魔になる
to interfere with one's studies―hinder one's studies
授業の邪魔になる
to interfere with the class-work―interrupt the lecture
眺めの邪魔になる
to obstruct the view―interrupt the view
病気が仕事の邪魔になる
Illness interferes with one's work―prevents one from working.
活動の邪魔
a hindrance to activity―an impediment to activity―a bar to activity―a clog on one's activity―a drag on one's activity
活動の邪魔になる
to interfere with one's activity―prevent one's activity―hinder one's activity―impede one's activity―hamper one's activity―handicap one's activity―bar one from activity
成功の邪魔
a hindrance to success―an obstacle to success―a bar to success―a barrier to success
成功の邪魔になる
to hinder success―bar success―stand in the way of one's success―prove an obstacle to one's success
通行の邪魔をする
to obstruct traffic―bar the way
出世の邪魔

a hindrance to one's advancement―an impediment to one's advancement―an obstacle to one's advancement―a bar to one's advancement―a barrier to one's advancement―a clog on one's career―a drag on one's career
進行の邪魔
a hindrance to progress―an impediment to progress―a bar to progress―a check to progress―what retards progress
進行の邪魔になる
to hinder progress―impede progress―bar progress―check progress―retard progress
二人の交際の邪魔になる
to prove an obstacle to―a bar to―a barrier to―the intercourse of the two
大望の邪魔
an obstacle to one's ambition―a bar to one's ambition―a barrier to one's ambition
通路の邪魔を取り払う
to clear the passage from obstacles―clear the passage from obstructions

しゅい〔趣意、主意〕
〈名〉
1. (=意味)meaning; sense; import; purport; effect

content.content: 君の言うことの趣意がわからぬ
I can't make out what you mean―I can't see what you are driving at―I can't make any sense of what you say.
彼が言ったことはどういう趣意か
What was the import of his statement?―What was the purport of his speech?―To what effect did he speak?
彼が言ったことはなんでもこんな趣意だった
What he said was to this effect―He said something to this effect.
彼の言ったのはなんでも文法廃すべしというような趣意であった
He said something to the effect that grammar should be done away with.
いま一人の言ったことも同じような趣意だった
The other man spoke to the same effect.
彼は僕の処へもそういう趣意の手紙を寄越した
He has written me to that effect.

content: 2. (=大意)purport; drift; tenor; gist; substance

content.content: それが僕の言ったことのだいたいの主意だ
That is the general drift of―the substance of―what I said.
彼の演説の主意はだいたいどんなことを言ったか
What was the general drift of his speech?―the purport of his speech?―the gist of his speech?
その議論の主意だけを簡単に述べよう
I will briefly state the tenor of the argument―the gist of the argument―the substance of the argument.
講義の主意を書き取る
to take a pr?cis of a lecture

content: 3. (=目的、動機)an aim; an object; a motive

content.content: いったいどういう趣意でそんなことをしたのか

もとの趣意を没却せぬようにせよ
See that you do not lose sight of your original object.
(新事業などの)趣意書
a prospectus

趣意が立ったらそれでよいじゃないか
If you have carried your point, what more would you have?

a prisoner under sentence of death―a condemned criminal―a gallows-bird

content:
しゅう〔衆〕
〈名〉The multitude; mankind; many men; all men; everybody

content.content: 博く衆を愛す、博愛衆に及ぼす
to love mankind―love all men
学力衆に勝る
His scholarship is above the common run―He is an eminent scholar.
福徳衆に秀づ
He is good and happy beyond the lot of many.
力量衆に優る
He has a strength beyond most men.
衆皆これを賛す
It met with universal approval.

content:
しゅう〔週〕
〈名〉A week

content.content: 西洋では下宿は週ぎめだ
In foreign countries, they board by the week.
一週十時間
ten hours a week
先週の土曜
last Saturday
来週の日曜
Sunday week.
先週の今日、来週の今日
this day week
今週
this week
今週中にできます
It will be ready in the course of the week.

content:

〈名〉A collection

content.content: 詩集
a collection of poems―an anthology
山陽詩集
Sanyo's poetical works.

〈名〉Municipal ownership; municipalization:(=の) municipally owned; municipal

content.content: 市街鉄道を市有にする
to municipalize the tramways
市有市街鉄道
municipal tramways

しゆう〔私有〕
〈名〉Private ownership:(=の) privately owned; private

content.content: 私有物、私有財産
private property
この学校は僕の私有物だ
The school is my own property.

content:
しゆう〔雌雄〕
〈名〉
1. (=男女)male and female:(=の) sexual

content.content: 雌雄生殖
sexual generation
雌雄淘汰
sexual selection
雌雄両性動物
a bisexual animal
雌雄同体、雌雄異体
monoecism―dioecism
誰か烏の雌雄を知らん
Who can tell the one from the other?

content: 2. (=勝敗)victory or defeat

content.content: 雌雄を争う
to contend for victory―strive for mastery
両軍雌雄を争う
The contending armies strive for mastery.
英国と海上で雌雄を争う国は無い
No power can challenge England's supremacy on the sea.
ドイツは世界を相手に雌雄を争った
Germany challenged the world―entered the lists against the world.
雌雄を決する
to fight―fight to a finish―fight it out―try conclusions with one
日本はロシアと満洲の平原で雌雄を決した
Japan and Russia fought on the plains of Manchuria.
さあ雌雄を決しよう
Let us fight to a finish―We will see which is the better man.
雌雄決し難き競争
a close contest―a near contest―a level race

content:
じゅう〔十〕
〈名、形〉Ten

content.content: 第十
the tenth
十番
No. 10 (number ten)
十分の一
one-tenth
そんな人は十中一人も無い
There is not one such man in ten―not one in ten.
十中八九
nine out of ten
十中八九はそう言う
Nine men out of ten―Nine out of ten―will say so.
(この病にかかると)十中八九は死ぬ
Nine cases out of ten prove fatal.
十中八九までは失敗だろう
Ten to one, he will fail,―In all probability, he will fail.
智者は一を聞いて十を知る
“A word to the wise is sufficient.”
彼は一から十までなんでも知っている
He knows everything.
一から十までご命令通りに致しました
I have obeyed your orders in every particular.
何十という
dozens of...
宅では日に何十という卵を使います
We consume dozens of eggs every day.

content:
じゅう〔従〕
〈名〉An attendant; a servant

content.content: 主が主なら従も従
“Like master, like servant.”

content:
じゅう〔柔〕
〈名〉The soft; the weak; the gentle

content.content: 柔よく剛を制す
Soft woman conquers hard man―“Soft words win hard hearts.”

content:
じゅう〔獣〕
〈名〉A beast; a brute; an animal:(=の) beastly; brutish

content.content: 獣肉
the flesh of animals―meat
獣皮
a hide―(小獣皮)―a skin―(軟毛獣皮)―a fur

content:
じゅう〔重〕
〈名〉(=重箱)a nest of boxes; a picnic box

content.content: 重詰め
food packed in boxes

content: 〈接尾詞〉(=幾重)fold

content.content: 二重
twofold
三重
threefold―treble―triple
紙を二重に折る
to double over a leaf

content:
じゅう〔銃〕
〈名〉A gun:(施条銃)a rifle:(猟銃) a sporting gun :(鳥銃) a fowling piece:(小銃) small arms

content.content: 銃が発する
A gun goes off.
銃が発せぬ(不発)
A gun misses fire.
はて不思議だ、この銃の不発は無いことだ
Strange! I never knew this gun miss fire.
銃を担う
to shoulder arms
銃を捧げる
to present arms
銃を組む
to pile arms―stack arms
銃を解く
to unpile arms
銃をかまえる
to come to the ready
銃をかまえている
to be at the ready
銃に剣をつける
to fix a bayonet
銃を分解する
to take a gun to pieces
火縄銃
a matchlock
単発銃
a single-loader
連発銃
a magazine-rifle
二連銃
a double-barrelled gun
空気銃
an air-gun

content:
じゅう〔中〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. ［時］Through (the night) ; throughout (the holidays) ; in the course of (the day, etc.)

content.content: 火事は夜じゅう続いた
The fire lasted through the night―throughout the night―all the night through―all night.
僕は休暇中東京に居る
I shall stay in Tokyo through the holidays―throughout the holidays.
頂上には一年中雪がある
There is snow at the summit all the year round.
今日中に、今月中に、今年中に
in the course of the day―in the course of the month―in the course of the year
今日中に仕事をすます
I will get the work finished in the course of the day―before the day is out.
今夜中に立ちのかなければならぬ
We must leave the place in the course of the night―before the night is out.
今週中に準備せんけりゃならぬ
Preparations must be made in the course of the week―before the week is over.
今月中に金を返さなければならぬ
The money must be paid in the course of the month―before the month is over.
今年中にある
It will happen in the course of the year―before the year is over.
僕はこの間中不在であった
I was away from home for some time back.

content: 2. ［場所］All over (the town) ; throughout (the land)

content.content: 彼の名は日本国中に知れわたっている
His name is known all over the country―throughout the land.
英語は世界中に通ずる
English is spoken all over the world―all the world over.
風説が東京中に広まった
The rumour has spread all over the town.
家の中じゅう探した
I have looked all over the house.
この本は東京中に無い
This book is not to be had in all Tokyo.
日本国中にまたと無い品だ
Its fellow is not to be found in all Japan.
家中一面の火となった
The whole house was in a blaze.
身体中{からだじゅう}
all over (the body)
彼は身体中いれずみをしている
He is tattooed all over.

content:
じゆう〔事由〕
〈名〉Reason; cause

content.content: 正当な事由無くして欠勤した
He absented himself without just cause.

content:
じゆう〔自由〕
〈名〉
1. Freedom; liberty:(=の) free; liberal; unrestricted; unrestrained:(=に) freely; at liberty; at one's pleasure; as one pleases; as one likes

content.content: 自由無くば死するに如かず
Give me liberty, or give me death!
ロシア人は自由と放縦を履き違えた
The Russians mistook liberty for licence.
去るも留るも君の自由だ
You are free to go or stay―You are at liberty to go or stay―You may go or stay at your pleasure.
自由を得る
to gain freedom
自由を回復する
to regain one's liberty
自由の身となる
to get free―go free―be set free―be set at liberty―be liberated
(出獄を許されて)自由の身となる
to regain one's liberty
僕は午後は自由の身だ
I am free in the afternoon.
言論の自由
freedom of speech
印刷の自由
freedom of the press
信仰の自由
liberty of conscience
意志の自由
freedom of the will
自由意志
free will
自由国
a free state
自由の天地
a land of freedom
自由民
a free people
自由党
the Liberal Party―the Liberals
自由党員
a Liberal
自由主義
liberalism
自由主義者
a liberal
自由思想
free thought
自由思想家
a free-thinker
自由貿易
free trade
自由競争
free competition―competition open to all
自由港
a free port
自由渡航
unrestricted passage
自由結婚
free marriage
自由恋愛
free love
自由廃業
free retirement from an immoral calling
自由行動
free action

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 僕は自由の身だ
I am my own master―my own man.
午後は自由の身です
I am master of my own time in the afternoon.
(彼は束縛を脱して)自由の身となって悦んだ
He rejoiced at finding himself his own master.
女は二十一になれば自由の身だ
A woman is mistress of her own actions at twenty-one.
彼は主持ちだから自由の身ではない
He is not his own master.
(君は金持ちで何でもできる)自由の身だ
You enjoy every advantage.
君のような自由の身でありながらもし立身しなかったら誰も恨めないぞ
If, with all your advantages, you fail to get on, you will have to thank yourself for your failure.
僕の蔵書は自由にお使いなさい
My library is heartily at your service―You shall have the run of library.
この金は自由にお使いなさい
The money is entirely at your disposal―You are welcome to the money.
どうぞご自由に召上がれ
Please help yourself to the cakes.
彼は自由自在に英語を操る
He has a perfect command of English.
自由にする
to do as one pleases―have one's own way―make free with anything―do what one likes with anything
それではご自由になさい(ご勝手になさい)
Then do as you please!―please yourself!―suit yourself!
人の物を自由にしてはいかん
You must not make free with others' possessions.
自分の物は自由にしてもかまわん(煮て食おうと焼いて食おうと勝手)
One may do what one likes with one's own.
人を自由にする(死命を制す)
to have a man at one's mercy―have a man in one's power
金を借りると債権者の自由にされる
If you borrow money, you will be at the mercy of your creditor.
男が女を自由にする(思を遂げる)
A man has his will of a woman―handles a woman.
女が男を自由にする(手の内に丸め込む)
She twists him round her little finger―turns him round her little finger.
細君が家の中を自由にしている(勝手に切りまわしている)
His wife has everything her own way―She carries matters with a high hand―She is the real master of the house.
自由になる
to have anything at one's own command―have anything at one's disposal
彼は金が自由になる
He has money at his command.
ここに自由になる金が千円ある
I have 1,000 yen at my disposal.
僕に自由になる(僕の配与権内にある)一番の地位を上げよう
You shall have the best position in my gift.
世間のことは自由になる(自由にすることができる)ものでない
You can not do what you like with public affairs.
これは人の金だから自由にならぬ(自由にすることができぬ)
The money is not my own, and I can not do what I like with it―dispose of it.
この刀は重くて自由にならぬ(振りまわしきれぬ)
The sword is too heavy to wield―unwieldy.
人の自由になる(死命を制せられる)
to be at one's mercy―in one's power
女が男の自由になる
A woman gives herself to a man―surrenders her chastity to a man―sacrifices her honour to a man.
俺の自由になれ
Let me have my will of you.
子どもは少しの手加減で自由になる(善くも悪くもなる)
A child is what you make him―wax in your hands―clay in the potter's hands.
生徒は教師の自由になる(どうでもなる)
The student is what the teacher makes him―wax in the hands of his teacher.

しゅうあく〔醜悪〕
〈形〉Ugly (face); hideous (disease); infamous (conduct); scandalous (behaviour, etc.)

content:
しゅうい〔周囲〕
〈名〉
1. (=周回)the circumference; the perimeter; the periphery; the girth

content.content: 周囲は直径の約三倍
The circumference is about three times the diameter.
湖水は周囲十里直径三里
The lake is ten ri in circumference and three ri in diameter―It is ten ri round and three ri across.
この島は周囲何里あるか
What is the circumference of the island?―How large round is the island?
この木は周囲二間ある
The tree measures 12 feet in girth―The tree girths 12 feet.

content: 2. (=環境)the surroundings; the environment; the environs (of a city, etc.):(=の) surrounding:(=に) around (anything)

content.content: 人格は周囲によって定まる
Characters are formed by the surroundings―The environment makes the man.
それゆえに子どもには周囲がなによりも大事である
Therefore surroundings are everything to the child―environment is everything to the child.
彼は周囲の悪風に化せられぬ
He is not influenced by his evil surroundings―none the worse for his vicious environment.
人は周囲の空気を吸収しないわけにはいかない
A man can not but breathe the surrounding atmosphere.
市の周囲は景色が好い
The environs of the city are beautiful.
家の周囲に樹木があるか
Are there any trees around the house?
周囲を見まわす
to look around one
周囲の事情
circumstances
彼が正直に生い立つことは周囲の事情が許さなかった
Circumstances did not admit of his growing up in honesty.
周囲の事情のしからしむるところだ
It is the force of circumstances.

〈名〉A military uniform

content.content: 獣医学

彼らは血路を開いて重囲を脱した
They cut their way through the besieging army.

content:

content.content: 歌が秀逸として選に入った

content.content: 充員召集
calling out the reserves

The shower passes away―(より)―The gloom clears up.

悲報に接して一座は愁雲にとざされた
The sad news cast a gloom on the company.

the profits of the trade―the gains of the business
この商売はだいぶ収益がある
Large profits accrue from the business―The business yields large profits―It is a profitable business―It is a lucrative business.
彼は多大の収益がある
He realizes large profits―earns much―makes much.
この投資はだいぶ収益がありそうだ
The investment promises large returns.
