content.content: 新兵が就役する
A new conscript joins the colours.
軍艦が就役する
A warship goes into commission.
会社はこの航路に就役すべき三艘の外国汽船を雇い入れた
The company has chartered three foreign steamers to be placed on this line.

しゅうえき〔終駅〕

content:
しゅうえん〔終焉〕

content.content: 終焉を告ぐ
to die

content:
じゅうえん〔重縁〕
〈名〉A double marriage; a cross marriage; an intermarriage

content.content: 重縁を結ぶ
to intermarry between allied families

content:
しゅうお〔醜悪〕
〈形〉Infamous; scandalous

content.content: 醜悪の行為
infamous conduct―scandalous conduct

content:
しゅうお〔羞悪〕
〈名〉Shame

content.content: 彼らは羞悪の念が無い
They are dead to shame―lost to virtue.
羞悪の心は徳の端{はじめ}なり
The sense of shame is the beginning of virtue.

content:
じゅうおう〔縦横〕
〈副〉
1. (=よこたてに)longitudinally and latitudinally; in every direction; like network

content.content: 国中縦横に鉄道が通じている
Railways cross the country in every direction―Railways intersect the country like network―A network of railways intersect the land.

content: 2. (=思うままに)at will; freely

content.content: 彼はいかなる問題でも縦横に論ずる
He discusses any subject at will―He is at home on any subject.
彼の文は縦横の筆致あり
His writings show a free and bold hand.
智略縦横の人、才気縦横の人
He is fertile in resources―full of resources.

content:
じゅうおうむじん〔縦横無尽〕
〈副〉Right and left; at will; freely

content.content: 縦横無尽に斬り立てた
He slashed about him right and left.
縦横無尽に暴れ廻った
He killed right and left.
彼はいかなる問題でも縦横無尽に論ずる
He discusses any subject at will―He is at home on any subject.
その説を縦横無尽に論破した
He pulled the doctrine to pieces―picked the doctrine to pieces.
縦横無尽に政府を攻撃した
He freely attacked the government―He flung himself against the government.
縦横無尽の批評
slashing criticism

content:
しゅうか〔臭化〕
〈名〉Bromination:(=する) to brominate

content.content: 臭化物
a bromide

content:
しゅうか〔衆寡〕
〈名〉Difference in numbers; disparity in numbers; odds

content.content: 衆寡敵し難し
There is no fighting against such odds―There is no contending against such heavy odds―The odds are too heavy.
衆寡敵し難く降参した
He found it impossible to fight against such odds, and surrendered.
勝敗は必ずしも衆寡によるものにあらず
Success in battle does not always depend on numbers.

じゅうか〔住家〕
〈名〉A dwelling-house; a residence

じゅうか〔銃架〕
〈名〉An arm-rack; a rifle-stand

content:
じゅうか〔銃火〕
〈名〉Rifle-fire

content.content: 銃火を受ける
to be subjected to rifle-fire
敵と銃火をまじえる
to exchange fire with the enemy

しゅうかい〔周回〕
〈名〉The circumference

content:
しゅうかい〔集会〕
〈名〉A meeting; a public meeting; a gathering; an assembly; a congregation:(=する) to meet together; to gather; to assemble; to congregate

content.content: 集会を開く
to hold a meeting
不穏の徒が公園で集会を開く
Riotous people hold meetings in the park.
警察では厳重に集会を取り締まる
The police strictly control public meetings.
集会所
a meeting-house―an assembly-hall―a gathering-place
集会条例
public meeting regulations

しゅうかい〔集塊〕
〈名〉A mass

しゅうかいどう〔秋海棠〕
〈名〉The begonia

content:
しゅうかく〔収穫〕
〈名〉
1. (=取り入れ)harvest; ingathering:(=する) to harvest, reap, gather in (rice, etc.)

content.content: 今年は好い収穫をした
We have harvested a good crop this year.
今は収穫時だ
Now is the time for harvest―harvest-time.

content: 2. (=取り入れ高)a harvest; a crop; a yield

content.content: 米は収穫が多い
Rice gives a good crop―gives a good yield―yields a good harvest.
今年は収穫が多い
We have a good harvest―an abundant harvest―a heavy crop―a full crop―a good crop―this year.
昨年は収穫が少なかった
We had a bad harvest―a poor harvest―a scanty harvest―a light crop―a short crop―a bad crop―last year.
作物の収穫が多い、収穫が少ない
The crops come in well―come in light.
本年の収穫は平年以上の見込み
This year's harvest―This year's crop―This year's yield―is estimated to be above the average.
予想収穫
the estimated harvest―the estimated crop―the estimated yield

content:
しゅうかく〔嗅覚〕
〈名〉The sense of smell

content.content: 犬は嗅覚が鋭敏だ
The dog has a keen sense of smell―The dog is keen of scent.

content:
しゅうがく〔就学〕
〈名〉Entering a school:(=する) to enter a school

content.content: 児童を就学せしむ
to put a child to school―send a child to school
就学児童
a school child
就学年齢
school-age

content:
しゅうがく〔修学〕
〈名〉Pursuit of knowledge; study:(=する) to pursue knowledge; to study→『

content.content: しゅうがくりょこう〔修学旅行〕

content:
しゅうがくりょこう〔修学旅行〕
〈名〉An educational trip; a school-excursion

content.content: 修学旅行に行く
to go on a school-excursion
明日三崎へ修学旅行に行く
We start on a school-excursion to Misaki tomorrow.

じゅうかぜい〔従価税〕
〈名〉An ad valorem duty

content:
しゅうかん〔収監〕
〈名〉Confinement; commitment:(=する) to confine; to commit; to commit (a person) to prison

content.content: 彼は官吏侮辱のかどをもって収監された
He was committed for contempt of court.
彼は今収監中
He is in confinement.
収監状
a commitment―a committal

content:
しゅうかん〔習慣〕
〈名〉
1. (=世の習慣)a custom; a usage; a convention; the beaten track

content.content: もと我が国では十台で結婚する習慣であった
It was the custom in our country―the custom with us―to marry while in our teens.
西洋では婦人に席を譲る習慣だ
It is the custom in foreign countries―the custom with foreigners―the custom among foreigners―to make room for ladies.
この季節には贈答品をやり取りする習慣にしている
We make it a custom to exchange presents―We make a custom of exchanging presents―in this season.
その習慣は今なお行われているか
Is the custom still in vogue?
その習慣は今は廃れた
The custom is now obsolete.
田舎では古い習慣を守っている
Country-people keep to old customs―cling to old customs.
世の習慣に従う
to conform to custom
世の習慣に従って僕も結婚しようかと思う
I think of getting married in conformity to custom―according to usage.
習慣を破る、習慣を脱する
to depart from custom―leave the beaten track
習慣を脱することを躊躇しては大事は為せぬ
In order to achieve anything great, one must not hesitate to leave the beaten track.
偉人は世の習慣を蔑視する
Great men have a contempt for custom.
これは言葉の誤用だけれども習慣が許している
This is a wrong use of the word, but sanctioned by usage.
この言葉遣いは習慣に反する
The expression is contrary to usage―This is not the conventional form of expression.
習慣的
customary―conventional
地方の風俗習慣
the manners and customs of a place
(英国の)習慣法
common law

content: 2. (=個人の習慣)a habit; a habitude; a practice; a way

content.content: 彼は毎日保養散歩をする習慣だ
He is in the habit of taking a constitutional―He makes a habit of taking a constitutional―He makes it a practice to take a constitutional―every day.
僕は賄賂を取らない習慣だ
I am not in the way of taking bribes.
収賄は悪い習慣だ
Corruption is an evil practice.
(タバコが好きでなくとも)習慣でタバコを飲む人がある
Some people smoke from habit.
習慣は第二の天性なり
Habit is second nature.
習慣というものは恐しいものだ
The force of habit is strong.
習慣というものは恐ろしいものでどんな難事でもたやすくなる
The hardest things are made easy by force of habit.
(どうする)習慣になる
to get into the habit of―fall into the way of―doing something
僕は近頃借金をする悪い習慣になった
I have fallen into the bad habit of running into debt.
彼は夜更しをする習慣になった
He has fallen into the way of sitting up till late.
善い習慣を養う
to cultivate a good habit―form a good habit
悪い習慣がつく
to contract a bad habit―form a bad habit
悪い習慣を直す
to get rid of a bad habit―break oneself of a habit
悪い習慣はつきやすく直り難い
A bad habit is easy to get into and hard to get rid of.
習慣的
habitual
習慣性
habitude

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 手前どもでは早寝早起きの習慣です
We keep early hours―keep good hours.
あの家では夜更し朝寝坊の習慣だ
They keep late hours―keep bad hours.

content:
しゅうかん〔週刊〕
〈名〉Weekly publication

content.content: 週刊物
a weekly (publication)
週刊新聞
a weekly (paper)
タイムス週刊
the Times Weekly Edition

content:
しゅうかん〔週間〕
〈名〉A week

content.content: 西洋では下宿は週間ぎめだ(下宿料は週間払いだ)
In foreign countries, they board by the week.
二週間
a fortnight
ちょうど二週間前に来ました
I came here a fortnight ago―this day fortnight.
今日から二週間目に立ちます
I have this day fortnight.

content:
じゅうかん〔獣姦〕
〈名〉Buggery:(=する) to commit buggery

content.content: 獣姦者
a bugger

content:

content.content: 彼は重患に陥っている

〈名〉A bullet

じゅうがん〔銃眼〕

content:
しゅうかんけい〔醜関係〕

content.content: 醜関係を結ぶ
to have improper relations with―keep company with―a man or a woman
その女と醜関係は無かったらしい
It seems that he had no improper relations with her―It seems that his relations with her were pure.

content:
じゅうかんする〔縦貫する〕
〈他動〉To run through (anything long)

content.content: 鉄道が半島を縦貫している
A railway runs through the peninsula.
半島縦貫鉄道
a peninsular railway

content:
しゅうき〔周忌〕
〈名〉The anniversary of one's death

content.content: 今日は彼の一周忌だ
Today is the first anniversary of his death.
明日は親父の七周忌だ
Tomorrow is the seventh anniversary of my father's death.
夫の一周忌も済まないうちに再婚するのは不体裁だ
It would be indecent of her to marry again before her year of mourning for her husband is out.

content:
しゅうき〔秋気〕
〈名〉The autumn air; the autumn chill

content.content: 風は秋気を含む
The wind brings the autumn chill.
霜満軍営
Bleak appears the silent camp,
秋気清
And clear the autumn sky;
数行過雁
Flights of geese wing southward way,
月三更
The midnight moon is high.

content:
しゅうき〔秋季〕
〈名〉Autumn:(=の) autumn; autumnal

content.content: 秋季演習

content:
しゅうき〔臭気〕
〈名〉Smell; bad smell; an offensive smell; a vile smell; a foul odour; a stink; a stench:(鳥獣の臭気)an effluvium(複数―effluvia)

content.content: 臭気を放つ
to emit a bad smell―give out an offensive smell―send forth a stench―stink
臭気芬々{ふんぷん}たる
stinking
臭気芬々鼻を衝く
A vile smell greets the nose―(動詞に訳せば)―It stinks―(形容詞に訳せば)―It is offensive to the smell.
(あの家へ入ると)妙な臭気がムッと鼻を衝く
When you enter that house, a vile smell greets your nose.
この漬物は臭気鼻を衝く
These pickles are offensive to the smell.
臭気鼻を衝くような乞食小屋だ
It is a stinking hovel―a squalid hovel.
臭気無き
odourless―inodorous
臭気を止める
to deodorize
臭気止め
a deodorizer

しゅうき〔週期、周期〕
〈名〉A periodic time; a period; a cycle:(=の) periodic; periodical

content.content: 遊星の周期
the period of a planet
周期彗星
a periodic comet
この現象は周期性である
The phenomenon is periodical―It occurs at stated periods.
周期性
periodicity
周期律
the law of periodicity―the periodic law

content:
しゅうき〔週期、周期〕
〈名〉A periodic time; a period; a cycle:(=の) periodic; periodical

content.content: 遊星の周期
the period of a planet
周期彗星
a periodic comet
この現象は周期性である
The phenomenon is periodical―It occurs at stated periods.
周期性
periodicity
周期律
the law of periodicity―the periodic law

content:
しゅうぎ〔衆議〕
〈名〉The discussion of an assembly

content.content: 問題を衆議に付す
to submit a question to the discussion of the House―lay a question before the House
衆議決せず
The House is divided in opinion.
衆議遂に決せず
The House came to no decision―The House arrived at no decision.
衆議一決す
The House has come to a decision―The question is decided.
彼を洋行させることに衆議が一決した
It was agreed that he should be sent abroad.

content:
しゅうぎ〔祝儀〕
〈名〉
1. (=祝賀)congratulations; felicitations; compliments; greetings

content.content: 祝儀を述べる
to offer one's congratulations―offer one's greetings―present one's compliments―wish one joy
新年の祝儀を述べる
to offer New Year's greetings―present the compliments of the season

content: 2. (=祝典)celebration; solemnity:(殊に婚礼)a marriage ceremony; a wedding

content.content: 祝儀不祝儀
weddings and funerals

content: 3. (=祝い物)a congratulatory present

content.content: 御祝儀の印しです
This is intended for a congratulatory present.

content: 4. (=心付け)a tip; a gratuity; a perquisite; a handsel

content.content: 女中(女給)に祝儀をやる
to tip the waitress
これは祝儀だよ
Here is something for you (to drink my health with).
召使いに祝儀をやらなければならぬ
We must remember the servants―consider the servants.

じゅうき〔戎器〕
〈名〉Arms; weapons of war

a member of the House of Representatives―an M. P

しゅうきこうれいさい

content:
しゅうきゅう〔蹴球〕

content.content: 蹴球をやる
to play football

a football team―an eleven
蹴球選手
a picked team―the eleven
ラ式蹴球
Rugby football.
ア式蹴球
association football―socker

content:
じゅうきょ〔住居〕
〈名〉A habitation; a dwelling; a residence; a domicile; an abode:(=する) to abide in (a place); to live in (a country); to dwell in (a house); to reside in (a place); to inhabit (an island); to occupy (a house, etc.)

content.content: 住居を定める
to take up one's abode
住居人
an inhabitant―a resident―the occupant or tenant of a house

content:
しゅうきょう〔宗教〕
〈名〉
1. A religion; a creed; a faith; a persuasion; a cult:(=の) religious; spiritual

content.content: 宗教は宇宙に対する我が身の関係の告白である
A religion is a man's confession of his relation to the universe.
それゆえに宗教の無い人は無い
Therefore no man is without a religion.
無宗教も宗教のうち
Irreligion is a sort of religion.
宗教を信ずる
to believe in a religion
君は何宗教を信ずるか
What religion do you believe in?―what is your creed?―Of what persuasion are you?
人を宗教に導く
to convert one―make a convert of one―work upon one's faith
宗教を説く、宗教を伝える
to preach a religion
宗教を弘める
to diffuse a religion―propagate a religion
宗教によって慰めを得る
to find solace in religion
宗教の為に死ぬ
to die for one's faith―die a martyr to one's faith
宗教に託して国を取る
to conquer a country under the mask of religion
彼は宗教に熱心だ
He is a religious man―a religionist.
宗教気違いだ
He is a religious maniac―a fanatic.
日本人は概して宗教に冷淡だ
The Japanese are, as a rule, indifferent to religion.
宗教の自由
freedom of faith―freedom of conscience

content:
2. 
〈複合詞〉

content.content: 宗教家、宗教熱心家
a religious man―a religionist
宗教心
religious sentiment―piety―devotion
彼は宗教心がない
He has no devotion in his soul.
宗教改革
a reformation
宗教裁判所
the Inquisition
宗教戦争
a holy war
天啓宗教
a revealed religion
自然宗教
a natural religion

content:
しゅうぎょう〔就業〕
〈名〉Beginning of work; working:(=する) to begin work; to work

content.content: 就業時間
the time to begin work―the working hours
就業時間中面会謝絶
Interviews declined during working hours.
夜間就業
night-work―night-shift

content:
しゅうぎょう〔修業〕
〈名〉
1. (=学業の修行)pursuit of knowledge; prosecution of one's studies; study:(=する) to pursue knowledge; to prosecute one's studies; to study

content.content: 修業のため上京しました
I have come to town in pursuit of knowledge.
彼は修業中だ
He is studying―prosecuting his studies.
(学校の)修業年間
the term of study―the course of study
中学の修業年間は五カ年とす
The middle-school course extends over five years.

content: 2. (=卒業)completion of a course:(=する) to complete a course; to complete one's studies; to complete one's education; to finish school

content.content: 中学を修業する
to finish the middle school
修業の見込み無し
He has no prospect of completing his education.
彼は先生に修業の見込み無しと言われた
He was pronounced a dunce by his teacher.
修業証書
a certificate of completion of study

content:
しゅうぎょう〔終業〕
〈名〉Completion of work; the close (of a school-term):(=する) to finish work; to leave off work; to close

content.content: 学校は十二月二十五日に終業する
The school closes on the 25th of December.
終業時間
the closing hour
もう終業時間だ
It is time to leave off work.

content:
しゅうぎょう〔醜業〕
〈名〉A shameful profession; an immoral calling; a life of shame; prostitution

content.content: 醜業に従事する
to follow a shameful profession―pursue an immoral calling―live a life of shame―live in sin―live on the streets
公然醜業に従事する
to live in open sin
醜業をやらせるために女を誘拐する者がある
Girls are kidnapped for immoral purposes.
醜業を営む
to keep a brothel―keep a house of ill fame
醜業を営む家
a house of ill fame―a brothel

content:
じゅうぎょういん〔従業員〕
〈名〉An operative

content.content: 鉄道従業員
a railway operative
電車従業員
a car-man

じゆうきょうそう〔自由競争〕
〈名〉Free competition; competition open to all

content:
しゅうぎょうふ〔醜業婦〕
〈名〉A prostitute; a harlot; a strumpet; a courtesan; a whore; a street-walker; a woman on the streets; a woman of the town; a woman about town; a lady of easy virtue; a demirep

content.content: 醜業婦になる
to begin a life of shame―go on the streets
あの人の細君は醜業婦上がりだ
His wife is a woman off the streets―He took her off the streets.

content:
しゅうきょく〔終局〕
〈名〉An end; a close; a termination; a conclusion; a settlement:(=の) final; ultimate

content.content: 終局を告げる、終局を見る

to end―come to an end―be brought to an end―close―come to a close―be brought to a close―terminate―come to a termination―be brought to a termination―be concluded―come to a conclusion―be brought to a conclusion―be settled―come to a settlement―be brought to a settlement
交渉は円満な終局を告げた
The negotiations have been brought to an amicable settlement.
速かに事の終局を見たいものだ
I wish the matter would come to a speedy conclusion.
事件はめでたく終局を告げた
The affair has come to a happy termination.
裁判が終局を告げるまでは被告に面会を許さない
The prisoner is not allowed to see visitors pending the trial.
交渉が終局を告げるまではどこへも行けない
I am debarred from freedom of movement pending the negotiations.
戦争は終局に近い
The war is nearing a close―The war draws to a close.
終局の決定
one's final decision
終局の判決
the final judgment
終局の勝利
the final victory―the ultimate victory
終局の勝利はいずれに帰するか
Which side will gain the ultimate victory?
人間の終局の目的は完全である
Perfection is the ultimate end of man.

しゅうきょく〔終極〕
〈名〉Extremity:(=の)extreme

しゅうきょくせい〔周極星〕
〈名〉A circumpolar star

〈名〉Collection of money; bill-collecting:(=する) to collect money; to collect bills

2. (=地口)a pun

content.content: 衆愚は一賢に如かず

ロンドンはたびたび飛行機の襲撃を受けた

content:

〈名〉End; close; termination; conclusion; issue; settlement:(=する) to end; to close; to terminate; to be concluded; to be settled; to come ［be brought］ to an end ［a close, a termination, a conclusion, an issue, a settlement］

content.content: 事件が速かに終結すればよい

事件が首尾好く終結してめでたい

content:
しゅうこう〔周航〕

content.content: 世界を周航する
to circumnavigate the globe―sail round the world

Do you still hold to your old opinion?
僕は是が非でも自説に執着するというわけではない
I do not persist in error―I am open to conviction.
幽霊の執着去らず
The ghost haunts the house.

content:
しゅうちゃくしん〔執着心〕
〈名〉Tenacity of purpose

content.content: 執着心の強い男だねー
You are tenacious of purpose.
彼は執着心が無い
He lacks tenacity of purpose.

content:
しゅうちゃくりょく〔執着力〕
〈名〉Tenacity; pertinacity; dogged perseverance

content.content: 執着力の強い男だねー
How tenacious you are!―How pertinacious you are!
執着力のある者が成功する
It is dogged perseverance that succeeds―It's dogged does it.

content:
しゅうちゅう〔集中〕
〈名〉Concentration; centralization; convergence; localization:(=する) concentrate (one's powers on one object); to bring (one's powers) to bear on (one object); to localize (one's attention on one point); to focus (rays on one point); to centralize (power); to mass (troops):(自動詞に用いれば)to converge on, focus on, centre on (a point)

content.content: 全力を一点に集中しなければ大事は為せぬ
You can not achieve anything great unless you concentrate your energies on one object―bring all your powers to bear on one object.
日本艦隊はその砲火を敵の旗艦に集中した
The Japanese squadron concentrated its fire on the enemy's flagship―brought its fire to bear upon the enemy's flagship.
我が砲火は敵の旗艦に集中した
Our fire converged on―focused on―the enemy's flagship.
注意を一点に集中する
to concentrate one's attention on one point―localize one's attention on one point
この発明は氏が多年精力集中の結果である
The invention represents years of concentration on the part of the inventor.
日光を一点に集中する
to focus rays on a point
政権を集中する
to centralize power
資本を集中する
to centralize capital
軍隊を集中する
to mass troops
衆望が彼の一身に集中している
Popular hopes centre on him―He is the centre of popular hopes.
皆の視線が被告に集中した
All eyes were turned on the prisoner.
集中的農作法
intensive agriculture

content.content: 十中八九はそう言う

(この病にかかると)十中八九は斃れる
Nine cases out of ten prove fatal.
十中八九までは失敗だろう
Ten to one, he will fail―In all probability, he will fail.
